title: American Veterans with Brain Injuries (AVBI)

title: Army Behavioral Health

title: The Arms Forces
content: Provides education and programs that allow Veterans with traumatic brain injury or post-traumatic stress disorder to be more easily understood and live a higher quality of life. Includes a network of trained volunteer Life Navigation Coaches who mentor and give individual assistance at no cost to the Veteran and the LEEF family support experience.

title: Navy Safe Harbor Case Management
content: Assigns a care professional to help sailors and Coast Guardsmen identify short- and long-term goals and develop plans to achieve them. Also anticipates and addresses the day-to-day non-medical needs of enrolled Service Members and their families and works to resolve any problems that arise during recovery.

title: Parents' Dependency & Indemnity Compensation (DIC)
content: Provides a basic monthly payment for an eligible surviving spouse. The monthly payment is increased for each dependent child, and also if the surviving spouse is housebound or in need of aid and attendance. VA also adds a transitional benefit to the surviving spouse's monthly DIC if there are children under age 18. The amount is based on a family unit, not individual children. Surviving parents are also eligible for this program.

Applications accepted starting February 1.

content: Provides support to surviving mothers and their families and works with Veterans and other Veteran organizations.

Classes focus on the importance of managing personal financial affairs, living within one’s means, having emergency savings set aside, setting and meeting personal financial goals and planning for retirement.

title: Wounded Warrior Battalion West
content: Provides and facilitates assistance to wounded, ill and injured Marines and Sailors attached to or in support of Marine units, and their family members throughout the phases of recovery.

title: Operation Military Kids - Virgin Islands
content: Provides support to Army installations and geographically dispersed military youth who are affected by the global war on terrorism.

title: Easter Seals' Military & Veterans Initiative
content: Offers Service Members, Veterans and family members services to help in transitioning to civilian life.

title: Reuniting with Your Loved One - Helpful Advice for Families
content: Access a fact sheet that provides information on ways to enhance your homecoming and communication during the holidays when a Service Member returns home.

title: ONE Freedom
content: Provides education and training for Service Members and families regarding responses to stress, and offers self-guided tools for increasing personal resiliency.

title: Project New Hope
content: Provides free retreats in a camp-like setting for Veterans and their families.

content: Access information from the Substance Abuse & Mental Health Services Administration (SAMHSA) about prevention, treatment and recovery support for mental health and substance use disorders.

content: Provides guidance on how to cope with the challenges and adjustments that children and families often face during a deployment.

title: afterdeployment.org - Spiritual Fitness
content: Learn how spiritual well-being can help you both cope with and understand your deployment experiences.

title: afterdeployment.org - Overcoming Anger
content: Recognize anger cues and learn strategies to manage anger. Offers an assessment, an electronic-library, game-based simulations and narrator-guided self-help workshops.

title: Returning from the War Zone - A Guide for Military Personnel
content: Helps Service Members and Veterans understand what to expect when returning from a war zone, how to handle the transition, the signs of post-traumatic stress disorder (PTSD) and where to go for help.

title: Safety, Health & Preparedness for Military Families
content: Access a fact sheet offered by the Uniformed Services University of Health Sciences that provides advice and reminders for military families about the deployment cycle, routine health and family preparedness for disaster.

title: An Online Directory of Resources for the Military Community - Warrior Gateway
content: Connects all members of the military community, their spouses and families to the resources they need for transitioning to civilian life.

title: Coming Home Project
content: Offers programs that address the mental, emotional, spiritual and relationship challenges faced by Veterans and families before, during and after deployment.

title: Camp Lejeune Deployment & Reunion Programs
content: Find pre-deployment, deployment and homecoming support services for Service Members and families at Naval Hospital Camp Lejeune.

title: Navy Returning Warrior Workshop (RWW)
content: Outlines workshops available to sailors who deployed as individual augmentees and their families upon returning home. Also maintains a schedule of RWW dates and locations.

title: Coaching Into Care
content: Provides coaching to the family members and friends of Veterans to assist them in supporting their loved ones during post-deployment and ongoing reintegration. This is a national clinical service providing information and assistance. For confidential help, call 1-888-823-7458.

title: Fire Safety for People with Disabilities
content: Learn about fire safety for individuals with disabilities and their families and caregivers.

title: Safety, Health & Preparedness for Military Families
content: Access a fact sheet offered by the Uniformed Services University of Health Sciences that provides advice and reminders for military families about the deployment cycle, routine health and family preparedness for disaster.

title: Family Support
content: Learn about VA support for families of OEF/OIF Veterans and Service Members. Find your local Vet Center for counseling, support and caregiver services for families of wounded warriors.

title: American Combat Veterans of War (ACVOW)
content: Recruits combat Veteran volunteers to mentor, coach and assist warriors suffering from combat stress, allowing them and their families to lead productive and fulfilling lives. Offers support services for Veterans, women Veterans and the family.

title: Coalition for Iraq & Afghanistan Veterans (CIAV)
content: Provides a central place for OIF/OEF military, Veterans, families and caregivers to find information on Veteran Service Organizations and community agencies across the country.

title: Wounded Warrior Project - Peer Mentoring
content: Provides recovering wounded warriors one-on-one friendships with peer mentors; fellow wounded warriors further along in the recovery process. Peer mentors are also available to visit with warriors’ families, if requested, to serve as role models, helping them visualize what can be achieved through rehabilitation and hard work.

title: Camp Lejeune Deployment & Reunion Programs
content: Find pre-deployment, deployment and homecoming support services for Service Members and families at Naval Hospital Camp Lejeune.

title: U.S. Army Warrior Transition Command (WTC)
content: Provides wounded soldiers and their families with information to help them through the healing and transition process. Covers administrative processes, benefits and resources, including career and education training options.

title: Coaching Into Care
content: Provides coaching to the family members and friends of Veterans to assist them in supporting their loved ones during post-deployment and ongoing reintegration. This is a national clinical service providing information and assistance. For confidential help, call 1-888-823-7458.

title: U.S. Army Warrior Care & Transition Program (WCTP)
content: Enables the Army to evaluate and treat soldiers through a comprehensive, soldier-centric process of medical care, rehabilitation, professional development and achievement of personal goals.

title: VA Benefits Page
content: Search the VA's benefits page for information on benefits for different disabilities and injuries.

title: Veterans Disability Compensation
content: Find out about service-related disability pay, how to apply for benefits, and whether you qualify for paid travel expenses related to a disability.

title: Wounded Warrior Entitlements Handbook
content: Learn about pay and entitlements for Service Members injured in a combat zone and receiving medical treatment at military facilities outside of the zone.

title: Wounded Warrior Pay
content: Financial support to Service Members medically evacuated while serving in a combat zone, including assistance in starting, changing or stopping entitlements due to circumstances and understanding tax-free entitlements.

title: Army Reserve Warrior & Family Assistance Center
content: Contains information on benefits, entitlements, financial counseling, peer support and other services for Army Reserve soldiers, Veterans and their families.

title: Family & Medical Leave Act (FMLA)
content: Provides information on the Family Medical Leave Act (FMLA), including links to FMLA news updates, fact sheets, and application forms to qualify for FMLA coverage.

title: Family & Medical Leave Act (FMLA) - Final Regulations
content: Describes military family leave entitlements in case a family member is called to active duty, in case of an emergency, or to care for a wounded Service Member or Veteran.

title: Tax Information for Members of the Military
content: Find Internal Revenue Service (IRS) tax information regarding combat pay, retirement plans, extension of deadlines and free tax return preparation.

title: Tax Relief for Retirement Plan Payments
content: Read about the Pension Protection Act, which allows Reservists to receive payments from their individual retirement accounts, 401(k) plans and 403(b) tax-sheltered annuities, without having to pay an early-distribution tax.

title: Military One Source-Tax Filing Service
content: Prepare your state and federal taxes with this easy-to-use program. Provided by the Department of Defense and it is and free to active duty, National Guard, and Reserve service members and their families.

title: DoD Military Pay & Benefits
content: Provides information on military pay and benefits, including Active Duty pay, retirement pay, survivor benefits and the Thrift Savings Plan.

title: Benefits.gov - Veterans Pension for Non-Service-Connected Disability
content: Find benefits information for non-service-connected disabilities, including general program requirements and guide to the application process to receive benefits.

title: MyArmyBenefits - My Benefits
content: Produces personalized financial reports to calculate survivor and retirement benefits for soldiers on Active Duty.

title: Retirement Pay Calculator
content: Use this online tool from DoD to find out what your estimated retirement pay will be.

title: Benefits & Entitlements Overview
content: Provides information on military pay and benefits including housing and subsistence allowances and National Guard and Reserve benefits and pay.

title: MyArmyBenefits - Benefit Facts
content: Provides information on pay, education, family services, health care, life insurance, soldier services, transitioning and retirement, Social Security, casualty/survivor and VA benefits. Benefits can be searched by category, component, life event, state/territory or index.

title: MyArmyBenefits - Wounded Warrior Disability Income Calculator
content: Estimates disability-related income as a result of combat and combat-related injuries. Requires valid wounded warrior-provided passcode and active Army Knowledge Online (AKO) account.

title: MyArmyBenefits - Wounded Warrior Sustaining Income Calculator
content: Calculates estimated monthly income stream based on injury date, rank, time in service, duty station, special pays and family status.

title: Veterans Disability Compensation Tables
content: Use easy-to-read tables to see how much your disability pay will be.

title: Defense Finance & Accounting Service (DFAS)
content: Access to military, civilian, retired, travel and contract/vendor pay. Includes information on wounded warrior pay, financial benefits and the Thrift Savings Plan (TSP).

title: Preparing for Deployment - Financial Considerations
content: Provides important pre-deployment information for families and individuals, including financial preparation.

title: Tax Information for Members of the U.S. Armed Forces
content: Find information on tax laws affecting the military and questions and answers on combat zone tax provisions.

title: Free Tax Help for Military Personnel & Their Families
content: The Internal Revenue Service (IRS) and U.S. Armed Forces participate in the Volunteer Income Tax Assistance program, which provides free tax advice, tax preparation, return filing and other tax assistance to military members and their families.

title: Consumer Financial Protection Bureau (CFPB) - Helping You Save
content: Highlights resources for Service Members to gain financial independence.

title: Coast Guard Mutual Assistance
content: Provides financial assistance for emergency, short-term situations. Learn about the various categories of assistance that are offered.

title: Injured Marine Semper Fi Fund
content: Provides financial assistance to injured Marines or other Service Members assigned to Marine forces to help with housing payments, adaptive vans or vehicles, education programs, and more.

title: Air Warrior Courage Foundation
content: Provides financial assistance to families of U.S. Armed Forces for medical expenses, therapeutic programs for children and support to surviving family-members of military personnel lost since September 11, 2001 or in the War on Terror.

title: American Legion Auxiliary
content: Offers a wide variety of services and support, including scholarships, mentorship opportunities, programs and resources to strengthen Veterans, Service Members and their families. It is the world's largest patriotic women's service organization.

title: American Legion Temporary Financial Assistance (TFA)
content: Program assists minor children of eligible Veterans through cash grants to cover needs such as housing, food and medical bills.

title: American Red Cross Emergency Financial Services for Active Duty Military Personnel
content: Get emergency help for Service Members and families, including assistance for food, temporary lodging, travel, urgent medical needs, and utility assistance.

title: Armed Forces Foundation
content: Provides financial support to Service Members for everyday living expenses, home improvements, transition and career counseling, funeral arrangements, travel expenses, and family counseling services. Download the Family Assistance Application.

title: Children of Fallen Soldiers Relief Fund
content: Offers college grants and financial assistance with housing, repairs, utilities, medical expenses and groceries for children and spouses of Service Members with disabilities and those who lost their lives in the Iraq and Afghanistan conflicts.

title: Fallen Patriot Fund
content: Helps families of U.S. military personnel who were killed or seriously injured during Operation Iraqi Freedom.

title: Fisher House Foundation Hero Miles Program
content: Provides free plane tickets to family members of wounded Service Members to visit their loved ones recovering at military hospitals across the country.

title: National Association of American Veterans - Services
content: Provides emergency financial assistance, counseling, scholarships, housing assistance and medical transportation.

title: Operation Family Fund
content: Provides financial grants for those injured and families of those who have been injured or killed as a part of the Global War on Terrorism, whether domestic or abroad, military or civilian. Assistance is available for food, mortgage or rent payments, utilities, emergency transportation, vehicle repair, funeral expenses, legal expenses, medical/dental expenses and more.

title: Operation First Response
content: Offers financial assistance to wounded Service Members for rent or mortgage payments, utilities, vehicle payments and repairs, food, clothing, transportation, and personal items.

title: Operation Forever Free
content: Provides assistance for Service Members and their families including funds for transportation, as well as modifying, remodeling and building homes.

title: Operation Homefront
content: Provides emergency assistance and information to Service Members, Veterans and their families to help support their urgent household needs.

title: Operation Mom
content: Offers support to the military, their families and those who support them by providing care packages to deployed troops, letters of encouragement, emergency funds for injured military and scholarships for dependents.

title: Pentagon Federal Credit Union Foundation
content: Provides financial services for wounded warriors including funds for day care expenses at Walter Reed Army Medical Center, hospice suite for Walter Reed patients with terminal cancer, payments for emergency financial needs and laptop computers for wounded warriors at the Fisher Houses at major military medical centers.

title: Rebuild Hope
content: Provides emergency and short-term financial assistance to the families of severely wounded OIF/OEF Veterans as they strive to build healthy and stable civilian lives. Assistance includes small grants and no-interest loans, help in developing realistic budgets, and complementary counseling and referral services. Donors can view individual Veteran profiles on the Rebuild Hope website and easily make donor-advised gifts knowing that 100% of designated donations are distributed to Veterans.

title: USA Cares
content: Offers financial assistance for wounded warriors and families, prevention of foreclosure or eviction and help with basic needs.

title: Veterans of Foreign Wars (VFW) - Unmet Needs Program
content: Offers eligible Veterans an emergency grant of up to $2,500 that is paid directly to creditors to address unmet financial needs.

title: Wounded Explosive Ordnance Disposal (EOD) Warrior Foundation
content: Provides financial relief to wounded EOD warriors and their families.

title: Wounded Heroes Foundation
content: Assists severely injured Service Members with physical, emotional and financial support, such as paying a missing mortgage payment, purchasing an accessible van, building or remodeling homes, securing a new mortgage at a lower interest rate and more.

title: Reserve Aid
content: Provides emergency funds to reserve Service Members and their dependents who are in financial need as a result of deployment.

title: Salute, Inc.
content: Provides financial support for Service Members, Veterans and their families through a variety of fundraising activities.

title: Family & Friends for Freedom Fund
content: Provides financial assistance to injured Marines and their families, those with post-traumatic stress disorder (PTSD), and to all military branches as the need arises. Download the Application for Financial Assistance.

title: Navy-Marine Corps Relief Society Financial Assistance
content: Provides interest-free loans or grants to help with emergency needs such as transportation, vehicle repairs, funeral expenses, medical bills, food, rent, utilities and child care expenses.

title: Air Force Aid Society (AFAS)
content: Helps relieve financial distress of Air Force members and families and assists them in financing their education.

title: Air Force Aid Society (AFAS) Falcon Loan
content: Provides information and instructions on applying for the Falcon Loan of $500 or less for emergency needs such as basic living expenses, car repairs, emergency travel or other approved needs.

title: Air Force Assistance Fund (AFAF)
content: Raises funds for charitable affiliates that provide support to the Air Force family, including emergency aid, education needs and financial assistance. Provides links to the Air Force Village Foundation, the Air Force Aid Society, the General and Mrs. Curtis E. Lemay Foundation, and the Air Force Enlisted Village.

title: Army Homefront Fund
content: Provides emergency financial and other support to the families of soldiers, with a focus on wounded warrior care and transition assistance. Includes cash grants, not loans, paid directly to mortgage lenders, auto mechanics, utility companies, doctors and other providers. Assistance is usually provided within 24-72 hours after receiving pertinent information from the warrior or family member. All requests for assistance are made through Operation Homefront online application for assistance.

title: Plan for Financial Readiness Before Deployment
content: Find information on preparing your finances before deployment, including calculating your net worth, understanding your income and expenses, protecting your savings, protecting your property, establishing life insurance and more.

title: American Red Cross
content: Search for local chapters that provide confidential services including counseling. Open to all military personnel - Active Duty, National Guard and Reserves - and their families.

title: Army Reserve Warrior & Family Assistance Center
content: Contains information on benefits, entitlements, financial counseling, peer support and other services for Army Reserve soldiers, Veterans and their families.

title: Dealing with Creditors
content: Highlights actions military families can take under the Servicemembers' Civil Relief Act to reduce loan obligations, prevent court judgments and avoid eviction and foreclosure.

title: Education Debt Relief
content: Assists with relieving the educational debt of veterans who are serving and have served in the US Military.

title: Emergency Financial First Aid Kit
content: Identifies and organizes key financial records and provides a quick reference file for your most important financial documents to help you maintain financial stability in an emergency.

title: Military & Family Life Consultant (MFLC) Personal Financial Counseling Program
content: Offers personal financial counseling to Service Members and their families.

title: Military HUB Financial Management Center
content: Guides military families to make the best military financial choices, build wealth and save money while in the military. Also coaches through the process of leveraging your salary to support your family now and after retirement.

title: Military Money
content: Provides educational information and resources to help military families make better financial decisions. Created as part of the U.S. Department of Defense's Financial Readiness Campaign.

title: Military Saves
content: A partner in the DoD Financial Readiness Campaign and the national America Saves campaign, Military Saves is a growing network of organizations and individuals committed to helping and supporting military members and their loved ones build personal savings arsenals to provide for their immediate and long-term financial needs.

title: National Military Family Association - Money and You
content: Learn about how to manage money, prepare financially for moving, and get access to government resources that teach military families about saving for college, paying taxes, and investing.

title: Navy-Marine Corps Relief Society - Financial Assistance and Counseling
content: Provides information and resources to educate Service Members and their families on the basics of responsible money management.

title: VeteransPlus
content: Provides free financial education and counseling services to Veterans, Service Members and their families that have one or more of the following risk factors: financial struggles, low credit score, lack of financial planning and/or a poor credit history.

title: Consumer Financial Protection Bureau (CFPB) - Servicemembers Civil Relief Act Information
content: Answers frequently asked questions about the Servicemembers Civil Relief Act.

title: Consumer Financial Protection Bureau (CFPB) - Helping You Save
content: Highlights resources for Service Members to gain financial independence.

title: Women Veterans Health Care
content: Provides information on health care services available to women Veterans, including comprehensive primary care, specialty care covering reproductive services, and rehabilitation, mental health and treatment for military sexual trauma. Contact the nearest VA Medical Center and ask for the Women Veterans Program Manager.

title: Women Veterans Health Care
content: Provides information on health care services available to women Veterans, including comprehensive primary care, specialty care covering reproductive services, and rehabilitation, mental health and treatment for military sexual trauma. Contact the nearest VA Medical Center and ask for the Women Veterans Program Manager.

title: Veterans' Widows/ers International Network
content: Reaches out to Veterans' widows/ers across the United States and overseas to provide fellowship and assist them with identifying and claiming survivor benefits. Also keeps survivors abreast of new legislation and news affecting benefits.

title: Armed Services YMCA of the USA
content: Offers essential programs such as child care, hospital assistance and spouse support to military families.

title: Child Care Resources for Parents
content: Provides links to help in choosing and paying for a child care provider and includes information on health and safety regulations in each state.

title: Coast Guard Family Child Care Program & Resources
content: Learn about the Family Child Care Program, which enables spouses or other family members of Coast Guard members to operate a child care business in their homes.

title: Easter Seals
content: Offers a variety of services, including child development centers, medical rehabilitation programs, job training, respite care, recreation and camping to help people with disabilities address life's challenges and achieve personal goals.

title: Marine Corps Child Care Programs
content: Learn about Marine Corps child care programs, and find child care services in your area.

title: National Association of Child Care Resource & Referral Agencies - Military Child Care in Your Neighborhood
content: Provides resources to help you find quality child care in your area. Offers subsidies when a non-military spouse is attending school, working, or looking for work.

title: Military Child Development & Youth Programs
content: Offers child development centers, in-home child care, school-age programs, youth programs, and resource and referral services.

title: Military OneSource Child Care Information
content: Offers programs that provide child care for members of the military and their families.

title: Military Families - Foster & Adoptive Parents
content: Find information from the Department of Health and Human Services for military parents who are interested in adopting or fostering children.

title: U.S. Department of Agriculture Extension/4-H Support for Military Youth & Family Programs
content: Provide quality educational experiences to military youth in photography, arts, computer technology and citizenship for military youth ages 5-19 on nearly every Army and Air Force installation world wide. 4-H clubs are also available to military youth living off post as well as youth of National Guard and Reserve families.

title: Free Respite Child Care for Soldiers
content: Information about a program through which families may get up to 16 hours of free child care each month for each eligible child.

title: Child Care Subsidy for Dependents of Severely Injured Military Members
content: Works with DoD to help provide families of severely injured military members with assistance to find and pay for safe, licensed child care services for a period of six months during their period of recuperation. Offers several publications in English and Spanish on choosing quality child care.

title: Coast Guard Child Care Subsidy Rates
content: Organizes Coast Guard child care subsidy program tuition rates and benefits in easy-to-read charts.

title: Military OneSource Child Care Cost Information
content: Find information on military child care fees, how fees are determined, what subsidized care is, and how waiting lists work.

title: Get Help Paying for Child Care
content: Provides information on NACCRRA's child care subsidy program and instructions on applying for child care funds.

title: Navy-Marine Corps Relief Society Financial Assistance
content: Provides interest-free loans or grants to help with emergency needs such as transportation, vehicle repairs, funeral expenses, medical bills, food, rent, utilities and child care expenses.

title: Operation: Military Child Care (OMCC)
content: Provides child care fee assistance for National Guard and Reserve families whose children are enrolled in non-DoD-licensed child care facilities. Also provides child care fee assistance for Active Duty families whose children are enrolled in non-DoD-licensed child care facilities.

title: Questions to Ask About Military Child Care Waiting Lists and Costs

A SCAADL calculator is also available to determine the monthly stipend amount.

title: Parents' Dependency & Indemnity Compensation (DIC)
content: Provides a basic monthly payment for an eligible surviving spouse. The monthly payment is increased for each dependent child, and also if the surviving spouse is housebound or in need of aid and attendance. VA also adds a transitional benefit to the surviving spouse's monthly DIC if there are children under age 18. The amount is based on a family unit, not individual children. Surviving parents are also eligible for this program.

title: Military Warriors Support Foundation - Homes4GoldStars
content: Awards mortgage-free homes to survivors.

title: Air Force Crossroads - Casualty & Loss
content: Contains information on handling the loss or casualty of a loved one, including dealing with grief, benefits, necessary papers, funeral arrangements and memorial services and more.

content: Provides support to surviving mothers and their families and works with Veterans and other Veteran organizations.

title: American Widow Project
content: Provides peer support to widows of Service Members through sharing stories, tears and laughter on an interactive Web site.

title: Bereaved Parents of the USA

content: Provides support and resources for surviving spouses and information about benefits and legislation concerning survivors.

Assistance includes small grants and no-interest loans, help in developing realistic budgets, and complementary counseling and referral services. Donors can view individual Veteran profiles on the Rebuild Hope website and easily make donor-advised gifts knowing that 100% of designated donations are distributed to Veterans.

title: USA Cares

title: Wounded Heroes Foundation

content: Provides information and access to services where and when the surviving family members desire. Go to this link to find all the benefits available through the Army for survivors.

content: Connects survivors with local support services that include but are not limited to grief counseling, financial counseling, benefits coordination, support groups and Garrison and surrounding area events.

content: Provides support to surviving mothers and their families and works with Veterans and other Veteran organizations.

content: Provides support to military families through local American Legion Posts.

title: Armed Forces Foundation Family Assistance Program

title: Military OneSource

title: Wounded Warrior Resource Center
content: Offers personalized assistance with military and government services related to recovery and rehabilitation.

title: Veterans Families United Foundation
content: Provides educational tools and resources, support, peer support and information for Veterans and their families dealing with war-related illness and trauma.

title: Wounded Warriors Family Support (WWFS)

title: Home Front Hearts

title: American Red Cross

title: Military Families - Foster & Adoptive Parents
content: Find information from the Department of Health and Human Services for military parents who are interested in adopting or fostering children.

title: United Service Organizations (USO) - Europe
content: Find information about USO Europe and the various chapters overseas. Access contact information and useful travel information.

title: United Service Organizations (USO) - Rhein Main Area
content: Find information on services and fun activities that support Service Members and their families stationed or traveling through the Rhein Main area of Germany.

title: United Service Organizations (USO) - Kaiserslautern
content: Find information on support service and recreational activities for Service Members and their families stationed in the Kaiserslautern area.

title: United Service Organizations (USO) - Stuttgart
content: Find information on support services and on-going morale building events for Service Members and families stationed in the Stuttgart area of Germany.

title: United Service Organization (USO) - Naples & Rome
content: Find information on support programs, recreation, and community events for Service Members and their families stationed in the areas of Naples and Rome.

title: United Service Organization (USO) - Japan
content: Find information on the support services along with USO Japan contact information for Service Members and dependents stationed in Japan.

title: United Service Organizations (USO) - Okinawa
content: Find information for Service Members and dependents on USOs in the Okinawa area including contact information, hours, services and location. Services offered included: free wifi, free international phone calls, gift shop, coffee shop, American style food and more!

title: United Service Organizations (USO) - Pacific Region
content: Find the Pacific Region USO on three countries with five locations and 18 Service Centers. Access support and recreation services from Hawaii and Guam to Japan and Korea for deployed Service Members and dependents.

title: United Service Organization (USO) - Guam
content: Find support services and recreation activities that include free internet, television, movies, interactive electronic gaming and refreshments for Service Members and dependents.

title: United Service Organizations (USO) - Korea
content: Find support services and recreation activities that include BBQs, fun fairs, cross cultural events, holiday programs, tours at reduced rates, monthly birthday programs and more for Service Members and dependents. Locate individual USO Korea sites, hours, and contact numbers

title: DoD Military Family Support
content: Find the homepage for the DoD's support programs and social media for military families of all branches. Stay connected with other families and learn about new benefits and programs.

title: Family Reading Program - United Through Reading
content: Offers deployed parents the opportunity to be video-recorded reading storybooks to their children which creates positive emotional connections and cultivates a love of reading.

title: Wounded Warrior Project Family Support
content: Provides assistance and respite programs for family members, spouses and/or caregivers. The My Care Crew makes it easier for friends, family and the community to assist wounded warriors and their families as they transition home through an easy-to-use, free private online community powered by Lotsa Helping Hands.

title: Joint Family Support Assistance Program
content: Provides support for military families who are geographically dispersed from military installation.

title: Blue Star Families
content: Serves as a bridge between the families of Servicemen and women and housing, emergency, education and other support services.

title: Hope for the Warriors
content: Enhances the quality of life for Wounded Warriors and their families with immediate needs grants, scholarships, professional development, wish granting and many family support programs.

title: Navy Safe Harbor Foundation (NSHF)
content: Supports the recovery of seriously wounded, ill, and injured Sailors, Coast Guardsmen, and their families.

title: Returning Heroes Home
content: Receive rehabilitation and housing services for severely injured OIF/OEF service members and Veterans.

title: Veterans Support Foundation
content: Helps disabled, homeless and needy Veterans with shelter and medical benefits assistance.

title: Military Families United

Services, events and advocacy programs include Camp Desert Kids, the National Gold Star Family Registry and Operation Frontline Families.

title: Hope 4 Heroes

Also offers transition assistance, counseling, career assistance and training, living skills, emergency funding, housing and family counseling.

title: Coalition for Iraq & Afghanistan Veterans (CIAV)

title: Air Compassion for Veterans (ACV)

title: Military Youth on the Move
content: Access information and resources for kids and teens on getting ready to move and what to expect, relocation, schools, volunteering and staying in touch.

title: National Veterans Foundation
content: Crisis management for Veterans and their families.  Find help in your state.

title: Operation Military Kids

Includes recreational, social and educational programs, state level initiatives, camp activities, mentorship, assistance with school issues and more.

title: Fisher House Foundation

Also sponsors a scholarship program for military spouses and children and the Operation Hero Miles, which supplies emergency airline tickets for Service Members and their families during a medical crisis.

title: Coming Home Project
content: Offers programs that address the mental, emotional, spiritual and relationship challenges faced by Veterans and families before, during and after deployment.

title: An Online Directory of Resources for the Military Community - Warrior Gateway
content: Connects all members of the military community, their spouses and families to the resources they need for transitioning to civilian life.

title: Association of the United States Army (AUSA)
content: Provides Active Duty Army, National Guard, Reserve, civilians, retirees and family members professional development opportunities and operates the Family Programs Directorate.  Also provides scholarships to soldiers and family members.

title: Camp Lejeune Deployment & Reunion Programs
content: Find pre-deployment, deployment and homecoming support services for Service Members and families at Naval Hospital Camp Lejeune.

title: National Fatherhood Initiative
content: Provides resources for families to record messages for their deployed fathers and offers a guidebook for deployed fathers and their families.

title: Joining Forces
content: White House program that asks Americans to get involved in supporting our military's needs in employment, education, wellness and public awareness. Learn how to get involved.

title: VFW National Home for Children
content: Offers a safety net for military families when a family care plan fails, supportive services for Veterans with children who are approved for VA Vocational Rehabilitation, a chance for Veteran-related single-parent families to get a fresh start and a loving home for Veteran-related children who need it. Call the National Home Helpline at 1-800-313-4200 if you need help with supportive services and resources in your own community or if you are seeking a referral to an on-campus program.

title: Armed Services YMCA of the USA
content: Helps make military life easier with free and low cost programs for junior enlisted military families at 33 branches and affiliates nationwide. Local programs and services focus on family life, recreation and fitness, medical and therapy needs and education.

title: VA Suicide Prevention Program
content: Lists suicide prevention resources for Veterans, Service Members and their families to reach free, confidential support 24 hours a day.

title: Military Family Support
content: A clearinghouse for a nationwide network of local information centers, which collect and organize information from city, county, and federal sources and make them accessible to military families. Resources include military base resources, help from public charities and assistance from the individual branches of the military.

title: Veteran Caregiver
content: Find a supportive online community for caregivers of wounded warriors and Veterans.

title: Family Support
content: Learn about VA support for families of OEF/OIF Veterans and Service Members. Find your local Vet Center for counseling, support and caregiver services for families of wounded warriors.

title: Gold Star Wives of America
content: Provides support and resources for surviving spouses and information about benefits and legislation concerning survivors.

title: Armed Services YMCA of the USA
content: Offers essential programs such as child care, hospital assistance and spouse support to military families.

title: Coming Home Project
content: Offers programs that address the mental, emotional, spiritual and relationship challenges faced by Veterans and families before, during and after deployment.

title: National Guard Family Program
content: Provides information on local and federal National Guard resources for families, including a local community resource finder and instructions to access National Guard benefits and resources.

title: Well Spouse Association
content: Gives support to wives, husbands and partners of people who are chronically ill and/or have disabilities.

title: Marine Parents
content: Provides a place for families to connect, share and support each other.

title: American Veterans with Brain Injuries
content: Offers support to families of Service Members and Veterans who have traumatic brain injuries, including a chat room and a Web-based peer support network.

title: CaringBridge Free Web Sites
content: Access a free, personalized Web sites that support and connect loved ones during critical illness, treatment and recovery.

title: Hope for the Warriors Spouses' Support Group
content: Provides support to military spouses to help them cope with the questions, stressors, lifestyle changes and uncertainties that arise throughout the recovery process after a loved one has been wounded.

title: American Red Cross
content: Provides counseling and helps with contacting a deployed Service Member anywhere in the world, including on ships at sea, embassies and remote locations 24 hours a day.

title: Armed Forces Foundation Family Assistance Program
content: Provides direct financial support to Service Members and their families for everyday living expenses, home improvements, transition and career counseling, funeral arrangements, travel expenses for military families, family counseling services and other related costs.

title: Military & Family Life Consultant (MFLC) Joint Family Support Assistance Program
content: Helps meet the needs of geographically-dispersed family members of Active Duty, National Guard and Reserve who otherwise may not be able to find support programs.

title: Military Family Program
content: Supports military families by connecting them with community organizations, local governments and businesses, as well as provides information and resources on family support, relocation, travel, pay and benefits, job boards and more.

title: Military HOMEFRONT
content: Offers programs serving troops and families, including child care and counseling services, help for family members with disabilities, and legal assistance.

title: Military OneSource
content: Speak to live Military OneSource consultants that are available 24 hours a day. Information and assistance available to Active Duty Service Members, Reservists and family members.

title: National Military Family Association
content: Provides information on education, employment, health care and finances and the Military Spouse Scholarship Program and an Operation Purple Program, which provides leadership camps for teens, family retreats at national parks and camps geared to address the needs of children and families of our nation's wounded Service Members.

title: ONE Freedom
content: Provides education and training for Service Members and families regarding responses to stress, and offers self-guided tools for increasing personal resiliency.

title: Quality of Life Foundation (QLF)
content: Serves the families of severely injured Service Members by helping them face the intense, life-changing challenges unique to their situations.

title: Strategic Outreach to Families of All Reservists (SOFAR)
content: Free psychological support, psychotherapy and prevention services to extended family of Army Reservists and National Guard deployed in Afghanistan, Iraq and Kuwait.

title: Wounded Warrior Project
content: Offers wounded warriors programs and services including benefits counseling, employment assistance, family and peer support, recreational activities and advocacy, to assist as they transition back to civilian life.

title: Military Family Link
content: Military family members can find resources on nutrition, Command Support, education, and more; as well as join an online community of fellow military family members.

title: The Arms Forces
content: Provides education and programs that allow Veterans with traumatic brain injury or post-traumatic stress disorder to be more easily understood and live a higher quality of life. Includes a network of trained volunteer Life Navigation Coaches who mentor and give individual assistance at no cost to the Veteran and the LEEF family support experience.

title: Military Significant Other Support (SOS)
content: Offers peer support, encouragement and information for military spouses and significant others in an online setting. Resources include understanding military pay, how to send care packages and coping with deployment.

title: Wounded Warrior Project - Peer Mentoring
content: Provides recovering wounded warriors one-on-one friendships with peer mentors; fellow wounded warriors further along in the recovery process. Peer mentors are also available to visit with warriors’ families, if requested, to serve as role models, helping them visualize what can be achieved through rehabilitation and hard work.

title: Blue Star Families
content: Serves as a bridge between the families of Servicemen and women and housing, emergency, education and other support services.

title: Wounded Warrior Project Family Support
content: Provides assistance and respite programs for family members, spouses and/or caregivers. The My Care Crew makes it easier for friends, family and the community to assist wounded warriors and their families as they transition home through an easy-to-use, free private online community powered by Lotsa Helping Hands.

title: Home Front Hearts
content: Serves the families that serve our country by providing support and resources to the families of Service Members, increasing public awareness of the struggles and sacrifices of military families, and engaging both individuals and businesses in building communities that are responsive to the needs of these families.

title: American Combat Veterans of War (ACVOW)
content: Recruits combat Veteran volunteers to mentor, coach and assist warriors suffering from combat stress, allowing them and their families to lead productive and fulfilling lives. Offers support services for Veterans, women Veterans and the family.

title: Hearts of Valor
content: Hosts support groups in several locations around the United States to improve the lives of the people who are caring for wounded warriors.

title: Military Kids Connect
content:
Find information on an online community for military children (ages 6-17 years old)  			that provides access to age-appropriate resources to support them from pre-deployment, 			through a parent's or caregiver's return.
MKC offers informative activities, fun games,  			helpful videos, and interesting user surveys that can guild and reinforce understanding, 			resilience and coping skills in military children and their peers.

title: Coaching Into Care
content: Provides coaching to the family members and friends of Veterans to assist them in supporting their loved ones during post-deployment and ongoing reintegration. This is a national clinical service providing information and assistance. For confidential help, call 1-888-823-7458.

title: Military Families Learning Network - Family Development
content:
Provides support to Service Members and their families through  engaged online communities providing best practices, information,  educational and curriculum materials, and  programming activities and  efforts.
The primary concentration areas for the Military Families Learning Network  are personal finance, child care, family development and network literacy.

title: Our Military Kids
content: Provides grants for children (3 years - 12th grade) of deployed National Guard and Reserve Service Members and the children of ALL Wounded Warriors to participate in youth sports, fine arts, camps and tutoring programs.

title: U.S. Department of Agriculture Extension/4-H Support for Military Youth & Family Programs
content: Provide quality educational experiences to military youth in photography, arts, computer technology and citizenship for military youth ages 5-19 on nearly every Army and Air Force installation world wide. 4-H clubs are also available to military youth living off post as well as youth of National Guard and Reserve families.

title: Blue Star Museums
content: Learn about this collaborative program of the National Endowment of the Arts and Blue Star Families that offers free admission to museums for all active duty military personnel and their families during the summer.

title: United Service Organizations (USO)
content: Provides morale, welfare and recreation-type services to Service Members and their families.

title: Wounded Warriors Family Support (WWFS)
content: Provides fully furnished resort condominium units for use by the families of wounded warriors and widows with the greatest financial need.

title: Armed Forces Recreation Centers
content: Learn about resorts operated by the Army Family and Morale, Welfare and Recreation Command for Service Members, their families and other members of the military.

title: Operation Military Kids
content: Provides information on the U.S. Army's collaborative effort with America's communities to support children and youth impacted by deployment. Includes recreational, social and educational programs, state level initiatives, camp activities, mentorship, assistance with school issues and more.

title: Compass Retreat Center
content: Offers a reintegration retreat to help Service Members and their families bridge the gap between military and civilian life.

title: Operation Purple Heart Family Retreat
content: Offers four day retreats in National Parks that reconnect families experiencing the stresses surrounding a deployment.

title: Samaritan's Purse - Operation Heal Our Patriots
content:
Gives 150 wounded Veterans and their spouses spiritual engagement opportunities and through retreats and recreation. Lodging and transportation included.
Applications accepted starting February 1.

title: Military Warriors Support Foundation - Skills4Life
content: Provide family mentorings and recreational outings such as hunting, fishing, golf, sporting events, family outings and vacations.

title: Tragedy Assistance Program for Survivors (TAPS)
content: Supports and assists surviving families of those who have died in service to America through a wide variety of programs including those for grieving children and peer support programs.

title: Army Casualty Web Site
content: Provides information and assistance for casualty-affected Army families and the professionals that serve Army family members in their time of need.

title: Non-Service-Connected Death After Retirement Preparation & Benefits
content: Provides information on non-Service-connected death benefits available through the VA, and a checklist to prepare for legal and financial issues that may arise in the event of a non-Service-connected death.

title: Army Long Term Family Case Management
content: Assists families of fallen soldiers with information on survivor benefits, obtaining service records, soldier services, support programs and more.

title: VA Burial Benefits
content: Provides information on VA burial benefits.

title: Burials & Memorials
content: Answers frequently asked questions about military burials and memorials from the National Cemetery Administration.

title: VA Headstones & Markers
content: Provides information on eligibility and ordering headstones and markers.

title: Casualty Assistance Checklist
content: Provides a survivor's checklist for casualty assistance for survivors from all services.

title: Casualty Assistance: An Overview
content: Works to regain a level of normalcy in the lives of family members of deceased, unaccounted for, or missing Service Members with final arrangements and with understanding and accessing certain benefits and entitlements.

title: Marine Corps Casualty Assistance
content: Provides information on casualty assistance officers, military funeral honors and other information for survivors.

title: Military Funeral Honors
content: Provides information on eligibility, governing law, DoD policy and other information on military funeral honors.

title: Air Force Crossroads - Casualty & Loss
content: Contains information on handling the loss or casualty of a loved one, including dealing with grief, benefits, necessary papers, funeral arrangements and memorial services and more.

title: Navy Casualty Assistance
content: Contact Navy casualty personnel toll-free at (1-800-368-3202).

title: Arlington National Cemetery
content: Provides help for Veterans and their dependents or personal representatives in determining eligibility for interment in the National Cemetery.

title: Navy Mortuary Services
content: Ensures prompt and uniform death benefits are provided to all Navy beneficiaries worldwide.

title: Deployment Health News
content: Access a daily e-newsletter that covers health issues related to military service, deployments, and information on service member and family support services is also available.

title: Commissaries - Store Locator
content: Locate commissaries and information on store hours, directions, phone numbers, contact information, floor plan, special savings and more.

title: Practical Tips for Military Families Living with Combat Stress & PTSD
content: Listen to a podcast from "Gift From Within" provides military families and the military community practical guidelines, tips and suggestions for dealing with post-traumatic stress disorder (PTSD).

title: Disaster Preparedness & Response for Our Nation's Military and their Families
content: Access a fact sheet designed to provide information on family preparedness planning for disasters, including special health needs, tips around evacuation, and creating a family communication plan.

title: Handbook for Injured Service Members & Their Families
content: Offers a handbook published by the Intrepid Fallen Heroes Fund that outlines benefits, rights and resources available to Service Members and their families to help with financial, medical, educational, employment, legal and other needs.

title: Mobilization & Deployment Resources
content: Contains extensive links to Web sites of organizations that provide assistance to all services and ranks in the Active Duty military and Reserves. Topics include mobilization, deployment and family readiness groups.

title: Operation Healthy Reunion
content: Provides tips to military families on how to reconnect after long separations and ways to cope with war and loss.

title: Returning from the War Zone: A Guide for Families
content: Receive a guidebook from the National Center for PTSD that helps military families become reacquainted with returning Service Members.

title: Reuniting with Your Loved One - Helpful Advice for Families
content: Access a fact sheet that provides information on ways to enhance your homecoming and communication during the holidays when a Service Member returns home.

title: Safety, Health & Preparedness for Military Families
content: Access a fact sheet offered by the Uniformed Services University of Health Sciences that provides advice and reminders for military families about the deployment cycle, routine health and family preparedness for disaster.

title: Sesame Workshop for Military Families
content: Watch the Talk, Listen, Connect bilingual  multimedia program for military families with children 2 to 5 experiencing deployments, multiple deployments or when a parent returns home changed due to a combat-related injury.

title: Deployment Health & Family Readiness Library
content: Learn about a full range of support services, policies and programs for Service Members and their families including self-help materials, information and referral services, military life skills education and counseling for individuals, couples and families.

title: Specialized Training of Military Parents (STOMP)
content: Learn about parent rights and responsibilities regarding special education services for military children in the United States and overseas. STOMP is a federally funded Parent Training and Information Center established to assist military families who have children with special education or health needs.

title: Sustaining Health Care Continuity for Military Families
content: Find information from the Uniformed Services University of Health Sciences for families preparing to move or who are encountering medical personnel and resources in their new surroundings.

title: MilitaryINSTALLATIONS
content: Provides a directory of over 250 military installations and communities worldwide, including locations of installation programs and services, maps and directions.

title: Designation of Beneficiaries
content: Emphasizes the importance for retired Service Members to update and file their Designation of Beneficiaries paperwork.

title: U.S. Military Handbook
content: Gives updated information on military pay, allowances, installations, benefits, TRICARE, social security and other important resources.

title: 2011 Base Installation Directory
content: Provides contact information for every military installation in the United States. From information about military housing to the commissary to the base dental clinic, you'll find the contact number and addresses you need in one easy to access guide.

title: Caring for Yourself While Helping Support Your Service Member
content: Learn tips and find resources to support the pre and post deployment process and ease reintegration for spouses and Service Members.

title: An Online Directory of Resources for the Military Community - Warrior Gateway
content: Connects all members of the military community, their spouses and families to the resources they need for transitioning to civilian life.

title: Tips for Caring for Your Newborn and Yourself
content: Presents common issues that all new parents experience in caring for their newborn.  A Courage to Care for Me fact sheet.

title: National Military Family Association - Moving Advice
content: Find information to help with the moving process to a new duty station or new town. Learn about military regulations and benefits and even helpful allowances you may qualify for. The Get Ready page gets you started. The Making the Move page gets you through the move and the Settling In page helps you when you arrive.

title: National Military Family Association Military Culture Tips for New Military Spouses
content: Provides basic information on the military phoenetic alphabet, military time and common acronyms and military terms.

title: Return & Reunion Guide for Marines & Families
content: Read this guide produced by the Marine Corps to help military families cope with deployment and learn useful tips for reuniting with loved ones.

title: National Military Family Association - Preparing & Managing
content: Find useful information including: legal issues, financial advice, family care plans, talking to kids, talking to families, child care, coping with emergencies and more.

title: SAMHSA's Resources for Military Families
content: Supports Service Members, their family members and communities during and after deployment by providing behavioral health resources.

title: United States Special Operations Command (USSOCOM) Family Guide
content: Learn about how to live according to the guidelines of USSOCOM as an active duty USSOCOM dependent. Discusses how you can be a part of protecting national security.

title: Strengthening Our Military Families Initiative 2011
content: Read the text of the 2011 Military Families Initiative to learn about the federal agencies that are committed to both strengthening military families and raising the quality of life of those who support the nation's Service Members.

title: DoD Strengthening Our Military Families Homepage
content: Learn about the 2011 initiative to support our nation's military families. Read quotes by the President, relevant articles and the goals set for the participating federal agencies.

title: Support and Family Education (SAFE) - Mental Health Facts for Families
content: An 18-session family education program for people who care about someone living with mental illness or PTSD. Workshops are organized into four categories: information about disorders, skills for family members, the experience of caring about someone living with serious mental illness or PTSD, and dealing with family, friends and professionals.

title: 7 Tools to Reinforce Military Family Resilience
content: Identifies seven ways to build family resiliency before, during and after a family member deploys.

title: Parenting for Service Members & Veterans
content: Built by VA Mental Health Services in  partnership with DoD's National Center for  Telehealth and Technology (T2) to provide a free  online course for military and Veteran parents with information and strategies to improve their  parenting skills.

title: MilitaryFamily.com Family Life
content: Read tips on begining and maintaining a healthy family life.

title: Coaching Into Care
content: Provides coaching to the family members and friends of Veterans to assist them in supporting their loved ones during post-deployment and ongoing reintegration. This is a national clinical service providing information and assistance. For confidential help, call 1-888-823-7458.

title: Effects of PTSD on the Family
content: Discusses the impact of PTSD on the family. A shorter version is also available.

title: The "So Far" Guide
content: Learn how to recognize and respond to children's reaction to the deployment of a parent. Provides information to help you understand and support children throughout the deployment cycle.

title: Courage to Care Campaign
content: Provides fact sheets on health topics relevant to military life, including caring for children, depression and traumatic brain injuries.

title: U.S. Coast Guard Office of Work-Life Programs - Ombudsman Program
content: Offers ombudsmen to Active Duty, Reservists and dependents of the Coast Guard. Ombudsmen are volunteers who serve as a link between the command and families by providing information and related services to families regarding sources of assistance available to them.

title: U.S. Coast Guard Special Needs Program
content: Directs members of the Coast Guard and their families to appropriate referrals and resources before, during and after relocation, and ensures mission readiness. All Active Duty members who have family members with professionally diagnosed special needs (defined as long-term and professionally documented medical, educational, physical, psychological and mental conditions) are required to enroll their dependents in this program.

title: U.S. Coast Guard Spouses Information
content: Provides information for Coast Guard spouses. Topics of information include work life, health care, education, employment, scholarships and deployment.

title: Family Advocacy Program
content: Provides clinical assessment, treatment and services for sailors and their families involved in incidents of domestic abuse.

title: Naval Services FamilyLine
content: Provides information, family support and volunteer opportunities for Naval families.

title: Navy Exceptional Family Member Program
content: Assists sailors by addressing the special needs of their exceptional family members during the assignment process, including medical, developmental or educational needs, accessibility, adaptive equipment or assistive technology.

title: Navy Fleet & Family Support Program
content: Services for sailors and families to support sustained mission and Navy readiness. Includes information on family support groups, domestic abuse prevention, ombudsman program, personal finance management, sexual assault prevention, mentorship and transition assistance.

title: Navy Ombudsman Program
content: Promotes healthy, self-reliant families through ombudsmen. An ombudsman is a volunteer, appointed by the commanding officer, to serve as an information link between command leadership and Navy families.

title: Navy Wives Clubs of America
content: Promotes a friendly, sympathetic relationship among the spouses of enlisted personnel, extends relief assistance to members in need and other families of the Navy, Marine Corps and Coast Guard personnel, and fosters a spirit of fellowship among its members and the civilian community.

title: Navy-Marine Corps Relief Society Visiting Nurse Program
content: Offers free home visits by Registered Nurses to Navy and Marine Corps personnel, their family members and survivors, anywhere in the country, regardless of military status. The Combat Casualty Assistance (CCA) Program provides free ongoing, face-to-face follow-up to Marine Corps and Navy personnel and their families affected by the Service Member's war-time service in Iraq, Afghanistan and the Arabian Gulf.

title: Navy Life Pacific Northwest
content: Resource for active duty Navy Service Members, Reservists and their family members in support of Fleet and Family Readiness, as well as to provide information on the Pacific Northwest Region for those stationed there.

title: Navy Morale, Welfare & Recreation (MWR)
content: Find resources for Service Members and their families to support community, morale, readiness and recreation activities.

title: Navy Family Support & Relocation Assistance
content: Provides a comprehensive resource for Sailors, Navy spouses and their families to access information about the Navy communities in which they reside or to which they may be relocating.

title: Navy Family Preparedness
content: Navy families must be prepared for various emergencies- with or without their Service Member. This handbook provides vital information to ensure families are prepared as their own "first responders" and includes information on creating a Family Emergency Plan, completing Emergency Contact Cards and compiling an Emergency Supplies Kit.

title: Navy Individual Augmentee (IA) Personnel
content: Click on the menu on the left sidebar and select "Sailor," then "Pre-Deployment" and then "Pay & Benefits" to find important information for Navy IA's and their families, including travel pay and pay changes to monitor. Read other information IA's can be eligible for such as Retroactive Stop-Loss Pay.

title: Family Readiness
content: Prepares Service Members and their families for separations during short and long-term deployments.

title: Guide to Reserve Family Member Benefits
content: A guide to assist families of National Guard and Reserve members in understanding their benefits.

title: Ladies Auxiliary of the Fleet Reserve Association
content: Offers support and scholarship opportunities to Active Duty Fleet Reserve family members.

title: Marine Corps Reserve Family Readiness
content: Information on the Marine Corps Reserve's benefits, family readiness programs and location of units for members and their families.

title: Military & Family Live Consultant (MFLC) Individual Ready Reserve (IRR) Call Center Program
content: Provides outreach to IRR returning Service Members to assist with challenges of successful reintegration. Outreach begins within 30 days of an IRR Service Member's homecoming and continues regularly through the first year of return.

title: Reserve Component Resource Center
content: Provides information for Reserve and National Guard personnel and their families on health care and support services, including tips on dealing with deployment stress and transitioning home.

title: Office of the Assistant Secretary of Defense - Reserve Affairs
content: Find information on income replacement, Tricare, readiness, mobilization guides and other benefits along with contact information for departments within Reserve Affairs.

title: Association of the United States Army (AUSA)
content: Provides Active Duty Army, National Guard, Reserve, civilians, retirees and family members professional development opportunities and operates the Family Programs Directorate.  Also provides scholarships to soldiers and family members.

title: United States Army Survivor Outreach Services
content: Provides information and access to services where and when the surviving family members desire. Go to this link to find all the benefits available through the Army for survivors.

title: Fort Stewart Survivor Outreach Services (SOS)
content: Connects survivors with local support services that include but are not limited to grief counseling, financial counseling, benefits coordination, support groups and Garrison and surrounding area events.

title: U.S. Army Warrior Transition Command (WTC)
content: Provides wounded soldiers and their families with information to help them through the healing and transition process. Covers administrative processes, benefits and resources, including career and education training options.

title: Fort Campbell Survivor Outreach Services (SOS)
content: Find resources for survivors by contacting Fort Campbell SOS, which provides services to the Garrison and communities closest to where families live in a holistic and multi-agency approach.

title: New to Fort Campbell Information
content: Find basic information on Fort Campbell and the surrounding area including schools, youth services, housing, post services, employment and medical services for families and Service Members recently stationed or transferred.

title: Free Respite Child Care for Soldiers
content: Information about a program through which families may get up to 16 hours of free child care each month for each eligible child.

title: Coast Guard Mutual Assistance
content: Provides financial assistance for emergency, short-term situations. Learn about the various categories of assistance that are offered.

title: Navy Safe Harbor
content: Provides non-medical support to seriously wounded, ill, and injured Sailors and Coast Guardsmen, as well as their families. Assists service members throughout their recovery, rehabilitation, and reintegration. For more assistance call 1-877-746-8563 or email safeharbor@navy.mil.

title: Sea Legs
content: Provides information and tips for Coast Guard spouses. Information topics include pay and benefits, deployment, change of station, support programs, health, finance and more.

title: U.S. Coast Guard Morale, Well-Being & Recreation (MWR)
content: Uplifts the spirits of the Coast Guard Family and improves readiness and retention through customer-owned and driven programs and services.

title: U.S. Coast Guard Office of Work-Life Programs - Family Advocacy Program
content: Designed to prevent and reduce the incidence of family violence and create an environment of intolerance for such behavior.

title: Army Behavioral Health
content: Learn about post-traumatic stress disorder (PTSD), traumatic brain injury (TBI) and suicide prevention. Includes help for children, couples and extended families.

title: Army Community Covenant
content: Features programs that support soldiers and family members.

title: Army Emergency Relief (AER)
content: Helps soldiers and dependents through emergency financial assistance. There are 91 AER Sections of U.S. Army installations worldwide. Find the nearest location here.

title: Army Exceptional Family Member Program
content: Works in conjunction with other military and civilian agencies to provide a comprehensive, coordinated, multi-agency approach for medical, educational, community support, housing and personnel services to families with special needs.

title: Army Family Readiness Group (FRG)
content: Provides a direct connection to Command information in an online setting for geographically dispersed units and families. Online tools include forums, video e-mail, a telephone tree and photo gallery.

title: Army Long Term Family Case Management
content: Assists families of fallen soldiers with information on survivor benefits, obtaining service records, soldier services, support programs and more.

title: Army OneSource
content: Provides information on topics including health care; family programs and services; soldier and family housing; and child, youth and school services.

title: Army OneSource - Managing Deployment
content: Provides online tools and resources to help families handle deployment. Includes a Soldier/Spouse Checklist, Deployment Survival Handbook, Army Guide to Family Readiness Group Operations, Deployment Health and Family Readiness Library and more.

title: Army Well Being
content: Provides soldiers and their families advocacy and support, including information on issues related to deployment, well-being and behavioral health.

title: Army Wounded Warrior Program (AW2)
content: Provides individualized support to severely wounded, injured and ill Army personnel and their families. Services to assist with career, education, finances, health care, insurance, retirement, transition and more are available. For more information and assistance, call 1-800-237-1336 or email  AW2@conus.army.mil.

title: Exceptional Family Member Program (EFMB) Respite Care
content: Information on the program that provides temporary rest periods for family members responsible for regular care of persons with disabilities. Care may be provided in the EFMP respite care user's home, EFMP respite care worker's home or other settings such as special needs camps and enrichment programs.

title: Military Family Program
content: Information for families on health, financial, benefits and other services. Includes a comprehensive Military Family Program Directory.

title: MyArmyBenefits - Benefit Facts
content: Lists fact sheets related to pay, education, family services, health care, life insurance, Social Security, transitioning, retirement and VA benefits for wounded warriors. Fact sheets can be sorted by category, component, life event or state/territory.

title: Strong Bonds
content: Find Chaplain Sponsored couple and family retreats to help you re-connect with your Spouse and family.

title: The Blue Box - Resources for Soldiers, Civilians & Family Members
content: Provides a compilation of resources for Army personnel in Europe on various topics from Casualty Assistance and Survivor Support, Family Readiness Support, Reintegration, Civilian Deployment to Rear Detachment Command Regulations.

title: Marine Corps - Resources for Parents
content: Provides resources for parents of Marines. Learn how to support your Marine and understand their training.

title: Air Force Personnel Center
content: Manages the Air Force Retiree Activities Program and the Survivor Benefit Plan, and the Air Force Assistance Fund (AFAF).

title: Deployment Guide for Families
content: Marine Corps Community Services (MCCS) guide helps families prepare and contend with a deployment. Provides references and information for families to use throughout the entire deployment process.

title: Exceptional Family Member Program (EFMP) Respite Care
content: Helps Marine Corps families with children with special needs by providing a few hours of respite care per week so they can leave the house, go to an appointment, or just rest, while knowing that their child is well cared for.

title: Family & Friends for Freedom Fund
content: Provides financial assistance to injured Marines and their families, those with post-traumatic stress disorder (PTSD), and to all military branches as the need arises. Download the Application for Financial Assistance.

title: Injured Marine Semper Fi Fund
content: Provides financial and quality of life assistance to Operation Iraqi Freedom/Operation Enduring Freedom (OIF/OEF) Marines wounded in combat or training, their families and other OIF/OEF Service Members injured while supporting Marines. Funds may be used toward medical-related travel, rehabilitation and recovery-related expenses, specialized vehicles and injury- or disability-related home modifications.

title: Leaders Guide for Managing Marines in Distress
content: Provides guidance and tools to leaders on what to look for, what to do and specific resources for helping Marines who are in distress. Includes general information on deployment related, financial or emotional issues.

title: Lifestyle Insights, Networking, Knowledge & Skills (LINKS)
content: Enhances family readiness by offering spouses an orientation to the Marine Corps lifestyle.

title: Marine Corps Exceptional Family Member Program (EFMP)
content: Mandatory enrollment program for all Active Duty personnel to ensure that Marine sponsors are assigned to locations where services exist to support their family members with special medical or educational needs.

title: Marine Corps Family Team Building
content: Provides educational resources and services to foster personal growth and enhance the readiness of Marine Corps families.

title: Marine Corps Wounded Warrior Regiment
content: Provides assistance to wounded, injured and ill marines; sailors attached to or in support of Marine Corps units; and their family members throughout the phases of recovery.

title: Marine Parents
content: Provides a place for families to connect, share and support each other.

title: MilitaryINSTALLATIONS
content: Provides a directory of over 250 military installations and communities worldwide, including locations of installation programs and services, maps and directions.

title: Navy-Marine Corps Relief Society Financial Assistance
content: Provides interest-free loans or grants to help with emergency needs such as transportation, vehicle repairs, funeral expenses, medical bills, food, rent, utilities and child care expenses.

title: Marine Corps Community Services Quantico
content: Find resources, support and recreation options for families stationed at Quantico.

title: National Guard Child & Youth Program
content: Virtual university with Internet cafe, arcade, learning lounge, gallery, bookstore and more.

title: Camp Lejeune Deployment & Reunion Programs
content: Find pre-deployment, deployment and homecoming support services for Service Members and families at Naval Hospital Camp Lejeune.

title: Navy/Marine Corps Housing
content: Find information about Military Family Housing (MFH), Unaccompanied Personnel Housing (UPH) and/or Community (Off-Base) Housing. Find comprehensive and quick-reference information for 80+ Navy and 17+ Marine Corps installations worldwide.
