Floor plans, photo tours, policies and procedures, programs and services, waiting list information, Basic Allowance for Housing/Overseas Housing Allowance (BAH)/(OHA), forms, contact information, utilities, schools, maps and much more.

title: Navy Child & Youth Programs
content: Provides developmental child care and youth recreational programs and services for eligible children and youth ages 4 weeks to 18 years of age. Programs and services are specifically designed and operated to meet the unique needs of the military mission and Service Members and their families.

title: Return & Reunion Guide for Marines & Families
content: Read this guide produced by the Marine Corps to help military families cope with deployment and learn useful tips for reuniting with loved ones.

title: National Guard Family Program
content: Provides information on local and federal National Guard resources for families, including a local community resource finder and instructions to access National Guard benefits and resources.

title: National Guard Local Resource Finder
content: Search by state for family readiness resources and contact information on program areas including financial, household, emotional, and health.

title: Strategic Outreach to Families of All Reservists (SOFAR)
content: Provides free psychological support, psychotherapy and prevention services to extended family of Reserve and National Guard deployed during the Global War on Terrorism from time of alert through the period of reunion and reintegration.

title: Strategic Outreach to Families of All Reservists (SOFAR) Guidebook
content: Helps parents guide their children through the coping process involved with having a parent in the military Reserves. Reviews the deployment cycle and common reactions to it.

title: Taking Care of America's Armed Force Families
content: Guide for National Guard and Reserve regarding family readiness.

title: Our Military Kids
content: Provides grants for children (3 years - 12th grade) of deployed National Guard and Reserve Service Members and the children of ALL Wounded Warriors to participate in youth sports, fine arts, camps and tutoring programs.

title: Yellow Ribbon Reintegration Program
content: Learn about the Yellow Ribbon Program for National Guard and Reserve Personnel and their families. This DoD-wide effort supports these personnel through information on benefits and referrals before, during and after deployments.

title: Army National Guard (ARNG) GI - Deployment Support for Families
content: Find information for ARNG families before, during and after deployments on programs including: ARNG 101, America's Adopt a Soldier, Dealing with Deployment, Family Assistance Centers, Family Readiness Groups, the Yellow Ribbon Program, Preparing for Deployment, Resilience and much more.

title: Air Force Aid Society (AFAS)
content: Helps relieve financial distress of Air Force members and families and assists them in financing their education.

title: Air Force Aid Society (AFAS) Respite Care Program
content: Offers a "break" for a few hours a week or month to families who have the responsibility of 24 hour a day care for an ill or disabled family member. This person may be a child, spouse, or parent living in the household.

title: Air Force Community
content: Supports the Air Force community with information on helpful military-related support information that affects daily life.

title: Air Force Wounded Warrior Program (AFW2)
content: Provides personalized services to combat wounded, ill and injured airmen and their families through regular communication and support for non-medical matters. For more information and assistance call 1-800-581-9437.

title: Army & Air Force Exchange Service (AAFES)
content: Provides quality merchandise and services to authorized customers to generate earnings to supplement funds for the support of U.S. Army and Air Force Morale, Welfare and Recreation (MWR) programs. Find the nearest BX/PX.

title: Military Family Link
content: Military family members can find resources on nutrition, Command Support, education, and more; as well as join an online community of fellow military family members.

title: Force Health Protection & Readiness - Deployment Tips
content: Assists troops and family members with deployment preparation as well as coping during deployments. Find individual branch resources and defense contact numbers as well.

title: Fort Meade Child Care Programs
content: Offers three child development centers as well as the Family Child Care Provider program. Active duty military personnel, DoD civilians, Reservists and National Guard soldiers on active duty status and Fort Meade DoD contractors are eligible for the child care services.

title: Armed Forces Crossroads - Deployment & Reintegration
content: Find information for Airmen, family and friends on what can be expected before, during and after deployment along with helpful tips for reunion.

title: USSOCOM Family Readiness Group (FRG) Information
content: Find information on FRGs, family readiness, housing, Tricare, military and family life consultants, medical clinics, handbooks, childcare and more.

title: Armed Forces Reserve Family Assistance Fund (AFRFAF)
content: Provides assistance to dependents of deployed Army Reservists or National Guardsmen who face short-term financial needs and other emergencies.

title: Navy Safe Harbor Case Management
content: Assigns a care professional to help sailors and Coast Guardsmen identify short- and long-term goals and develop plans to achieve them. Also anticipates and addresses the day-to-day non-medical needs of enrolled Service Members and their families and works to resolve any problems that arise during recovery.

title: Navy Returning Warrior Workshop (RWW)
content: Outlines workshops available to sailors who deployed as individual augmentees and their families upon returning home. Also maintains a schedule of RWW dates and locations.

title: eArmy Family Messaging System
content: Provides commanders the ability to broadcast messages via text, email and/or voice to soldiers and family members in a timely manner. Designed to keep soldiers and family members informed and to enhance their communications.

title: U.S. Army Warrior Care & Transition Program (WCTP)
content: Enables the Army to evaluate and treat soldiers through a comprehensive, soldier-centric process of medical care, rehabilitation, professional development and achievement of personal goals.

title: U.S. Coast Guard Chief Petty Officers Association
content: Helps Coast Guard families assimilate into the local community by providing information about stores, schools and churches and help dependents of members away from their families feel welcome and part of the Coast Guard family.

title: Views from the Homefront - RAND Report
content: Find research on the effects of deployments on military spouses and children including analysis of previous studies and recommendations from RAND based on their research.

title: Focus on Family - Know Before You Go
content: Find information on preparing for and coping with deployment for both "experts" and fellow Service Members and spouses. This link also has branch specific deployment resources.

title: Force Health Protection & Readiness - Deployment Tips
content: Assists troops and family members with deployment preparation as well as coping during deployments. Find individual branch resources and defense contact numbers as well.

title: Our Military Kids
content: Provides grants for children (3 years - 12th grade) of deployed National Guard and Reserve Service Members and the children of ALL Wounded Warriors to participate in youth sports, fine arts, camps and tutoring programs.

title: Coming Home - A Guide for Spouses
content: Learn about emotional considerations for spouses and children regarding reuniting with a returning Service Member.

title: Family Separation Guide
content: Learn how to prepare for a deployment, including information on how to prepare a family care plan, wills, financial duties, and power of attorney forms.

title: Maintaining a Strong Relationship with Your Guard or Reserve Spouse
content: Provides information to spouses of National Guard and Reserve members on how to adjust to a Reservist's lifestyle, prepare for deployments, and seek support.

title: Mental Health Resources for Returning Veterans & Their Families
content: Access information from the Substance Abuse & Mental Health Services Administration (SAMHSA) about prevention, treatment and recovery support for mental health and substance use disorders.

title: Iraq & Afghanistan Veterans of America (IAVA) - Support Your Vet
content: Find information about navigating the VA, mental health issues, and talking to your Veteran or Service Member about combat experiences. Provides a Web forum for family and friends of Veterans and Service Members to discuss care issues.

title: Operation Healthy Reunion
content: Provides tips to military families on how to reconnect after long separations and ways to cope with war and loss.

title: Preparing for Deployments
content: Provides artilces on how to prepare for deployment in all Services, an online handbook for dealing with deployment while your loved one is away, and answers to frequently asked questions.

title: Returning from the War Zone - A Guide for Families of Military Members
content: Helps family members understand what to expect during the reintegration following time in a war zone and the signs of post-traumatic stress disorder (PTSD).

title: Returning from the War Zone - A Guide for Military Personnel
content: Helps Service Members and Veterans understand what to expect when returning from a war zone, how to handle the transition, the signs of post-traumatic stress disorder (PTSD) and where to go for help.

title: Support & Family Education (SAFE) - Mental Health Facts for Families
content: Provides access to free curriculum for people who care about someone who has a mental illness or post-traumatic stress disorder (PTSD).

title: War Zone Related Stress Reactions - What Families Need to Know
content: Access a fact sheet developed by the National Center for Post-Traumatic Stress Disorder (PTSD) that provides information and tips for families.

title: Military Family Link
content: Military family members can find resources on nutrition, Command Support, education, and more; as well as join an online community of fellow military family members.

title: Caring for Yourself While Helping Support Your Service Member
content: Learn tips and find resources to support the pre and post deployment process and ease reintegration for spouses and Service Members.

title: Preparing for Deployment - Financial Considerations
content: Provides important pre-deployment information for families and individuals, including financial preparation.

title: DoD Military Family Support
content: Find the homepage for the DoD's support programs and social media for military families of all branches. Stay connected with other families and learn about new benefits and programs.

title: Boosting Family Resilience (Real Warriors Campaign)
content: Find tips for strengthening families through all stages of military life along with resources that family centers on bases can provide.

title: Family Reading Program - United Through Reading
content: Offers deployed parents the opportunity to be video-recorded reading storybooks to their children which creates positive emotional connections and cultivates a love of reading.

title: Military Significant Other Support (SOS)
content: Offers peer support, encouragement and information for military spouses and significant others in an online setting. Resources include understanding military pay, how to send care packages and coping with deployment.

title: Blue Star Families
content: Serves as a bridge between the families of Servicemen and women and housing, emergency, education and other support services.

title: Family & Friends: Deployment & DoD Health Care Services
content: Provides information for Service Members and their families on coping with deployment and DoD health care services. Many of these services are available online, as well as by phone, with call centers ready to assist you 24 hours a day, 7 days a week.

title: Reserve Component Resource Center
content: Provides information for Reserve and National Guard personnel and their families on health care and support services, including tips on dealing with deployment stress and transitioning home.

title: Teens & Deployment - What to Expect & How to Help
content: Learn what you and your family can do to help teenage children cope with deployment. Steps include preparing for deployment and what to do before a homecoming.

title: Operation Military Kids
content: Provides information on the U.S. Army's collaborative effort with America's communities to support children and youth impacted by deployment. Includes recreational, social and educational programs, state level initiatives, camp activities, mentorship, assistance with school issues and more.

title: Department of Defense Education Activity (DODEA)
content: Visit the homepage for the DoD's education program. Learn about education options for active duty children both stateside and abroad.

title: Camp Lejeune Deployment & Reunion Programs
content: Find pre-deployment, deployment and homecoming support services for Service Members and families at Naval Hospital Camp Lejeune.

title: Return & Reunion Guide for Marines & Families
content: Read this guide produced by the Marine Corps to help military families cope with deployment and learn useful tips for reuniting with loved ones.

title: National Military Family Association - Preparing & Managing
content: Find useful information including: legal issues, financial advice, family care plans, talking to kids, talking to families, child care, coping with emergencies and more.

title: Armed Forces Crossroads - Deployment & Reintegration
content: Find information for Airmen, family and friends on what can be expected before, during and after deployment along with helpful tips for reunion.

title: SAMHSA's Resources for Military Families
content: Supports Service Members, their family members and communities during and after deployment by providing behavioral health resources.

title: National Military Family Association - Talking to Children about Deployment
content: Find useful tips for talking with and supporting your children during a loved one's deployment.

title: National Military Family Association - Support for Parents of the Deployed
content: Learn useful tips and advice for coping with a son or daughter's deployment. This link provides a reading list to help with the process.

title: Real Warrior Campaign - Managing Stress & Building Resilience
content: Learn helpful information, skills and tools to help you and your family prepare and cope before, during and after a loved one's deployment.

title: National Fatherhood Initiative
content: Provides resources for families to record messages for their deployed fathers and offers a guidebook for deployed fathers and their families.

title: Yellow Ribbon Reintegration Program
content: Learn about the Yellow Ribbon Program for National Guard and Reserve Personnel and their families. This DoD-wide effort supports these personnel through information on benefits and referrals before, during and after deployments.

title: Army National Guard (ARNG) GI - Deployment Support for Families
content: Find information for ARNG families before, during and after deployments on programs including: ARNG 101, America's Adopt a Soldier, Dealing with Deployment, Family Assistance Centers, Family Readiness Groups, the Yellow Ribbon Program, Preparing for Deployment, Resilience and much more.

title: Armed Forces Reserve Family Assistance Fund (AFRFAF)
content: Provides assistance to dependents of deployed Army Reservists or National Guardsmen who face short-term financial needs and other emergencies.

title: Operation Shower
content: Supporting military families by delivering baby products and hosting showers for expectant mothers whose spouses have recently, or are in the midst of, deployment.

title: Navy Returning Warrior Workshop (RWW)
content: Outlines workshops available to sailors who deployed as individual augmentees and their families upon returning home. Also maintains a schedule of RWW dates and locations.

title: Everyone Serves - Handbook for Families & Friends of Service Members
content: Helps families and friends of Service Members throughout the deployment and reintegration process. Produced in partnership with Blue Star Families.

title: Parenting for Service Members & Veterans
content: Built by VA Mental Health Services in  partnership with DoD's National Center for  Telehealth and Technology (T2) to provide a free  online course for military and Veteran parents with information and strategies to improve their  parenting skills.

title: Military Kids Connect
content:
Find information on an online community for military children (ages 6-17 years old)  			that provides access to age-appropriate resources to support them from pre-deployment, 			through a parent's or caregiver's return.
MKC offers informative activities, fun games,  			helpful videos, and interesting user surveys that can guild and reinforce understanding, 			resilience and coping skills in military children and their peers.

title: Military Deployment Guide: Preparing You & Your Family for the Road Ahead
content: Serves as a resource for soldiers and their family members during the deployment process. Helps families navigate the challenges of a Service Member's return and reintegration after the deployment.

title: Military OneSource - Plan My Deployment
content: Helps with the challenges of maintaining      readiness, managing separations, and planning successful reunions.

title: MilitaryFamily.com Deployment Readiness
content: Find information and advice on deployment and reunion.

title: Military Families - Learning Communities
content: Top experts in each of the military’s service branches address issues of military culture, the impact of military deployment on children and families, and the perspectives of those serving in the U.S. Armed Services. Provides podcasts for those who care for military children and families.

title: Children of Military Service Members Resource Guide
content: Helps parents and health care providers address the mental and emotional needs of military children through topic-specific, age-related literature. Topics include community, deployment, homecoming, mental/emotional health and moving.

title: The "So Far" Guide
content: Learn how to recognize and respond to children's reaction to the deployment of a parent. Provides information to help you understand and support children throughout the deployment cycle.

title: Courage to Care Campaign
content: Provides fact sheets on health topics relevant to military life, including caring for children, depression and traumatic brain injuries.

title: 1st Marine Division Association Scholarship Fund
content: Provides grants of up to $1,750 for full-time students who are the dependents of deceased or totally and permanently disabled members of the association.

title: 2010 Getting Uncle Sam to Pay for Your College Degree
content: Written for active military personnel, covers everything you need to know about: the G.I. Bill, tuition assistance, scholarships, Veteran benefits, student aid and selecting the right degree for you.

title: Air Force Aid Society (AFAS) Education and Grants
content: Provides need-based academic grants to children of Active Duty, Reserve, retired and deceased Air Force members.

title: Air Force Association (AFA) Scholarships & Grants
content: Learn about awards, scholarships and grants offered by the AFA, a civilian education organization that works to promote public understanding and appreciation of the role of aerospace power in national defense.

title: Air Force Personnel Center
content: Manages the Air Force Retiree Activities Program and the Survivor Benefit Plan, and the Air Force Assistance Fund (AFAF).

title: Air Force Sergeants Association & Airmen Memorial Foundation
content: Provides college grants and other financial assistance to children and spouses of service members killed in Iraq or Afghanistan, as well as to the families of service members disabled in these wars.

title: American Legion Legacy Scholarship
content: Provides scholarships for children of active duty military, Guard and Reserve personnel who died on active duty on or after September 11, 2001.

title: Armed Forces Children's Education Fund
content: Provides financial assistance to the surviving children of service members killed on or after October 7, 2001 as part of Operation Enduring Freedom in Afghanistan. Qualifications and an application for the scholarship.

title: Army Aviation Association of America
content: Supports Army Aviation soldiers and families with financial assistance for college-level education of members and spouses, unmarried siblings, unmarried children and unmarried grandchildren of current and deceased members.

title: Army Emergency Relief Scholarship Program
content: Provides scholarships to children and spouses of active duty, retired or deceased soldiers.

title: Children of Fallen Soldiers Relief Fund
content: Provides college grants and other financial assistance to children and spouses of service members killed in Iraq or Afghanistan, as well as to the families of service members disabled in these wars.

title: National Military Family Association - Spouse Education
content: Learn about the National Military Family Association's resources for spouses and children of Service Members.

title: Folds of Honor Foundation
content: Provides educational scholarships for dependents and spouses of Service Members who were either killed or disabled while serving and defending our nation.

title: Gold Star Wives of America - Resources
content: Links to resources for widows/widowers and special resources for widows/widowers of Operations Enduring Freedom and Iraqi Freedom (OEF and OIF). Includes counseling services, financial assistance and help with paying for college.

title: Liberty University's Heroes Fund Scholarship
content: Offered to Service Members, Veterans and their survivors who were wounded in Operations Desert Storm, Enduring Freedom, or Iraqi Freedom. Call 1-800-424-9595. Click here for the Heroes Fund Scholarship Application.

title: Marine Corps - Law Enforcement Foundation, Inc.
content: Provides financial assistance for scholarships and health care to children of Marines or federal law enforcement personnel who were killed on duty or died under extraordinary circumstances while serving our country at home or abroad.

title: Military Officers Association of America Scholarship Fund
content: Provides educational assistance for children of military families.

title: Navy League of the United States Scholarship Program
content: Offers college scholarships based on need and academic achievement to children of current and former members of the Navy.

title: Navy-Marine Corps Relief Society Scholarship Program
content: Provides educational assistance for children and unremarried spouses of deceased Service Members.

title: Patriot Guard Riders Fallen Warrior Scholarship
content: Provides financial assistance in the form of scholarships to U.S. military family members of our Fallen Warriors in their pursuit of higher education. One-year scholarships of $2000 are awarded annually, and are limited to undergraduate studies at accredited educational/technical institutions.

title: Scholarships for Military Children
content: Awarded to children of Active Duty personnel, Reserve/National Guard and retired military members or survivors of deceased members.

title: Special Operations Warrior Foundation College Scholarship
content: Offers college scholarships, financial aid and educational counseling for children of Army, Navy, Air Force and Marine Corps Special Operations personnel who were killed in an operational mission or training accident.

title: Survivors' & Dependents' Educational Assistance
content: Provides eligibility, application, benefit period and payment limit information for eligible spouses and children of certain Veterans who can receive benefits for education, training and testing.

title: Survivors' & Dependents' Educational Assistance (DEA) Program
content: Provides education and training opportunities to eligible dependents of certain Veterans. A fact sheet on the VA SDEA program is also available.

title: That Others May Live Scholarships
content: Provides scholarships, family counseling and aid to the surviving children of the U.S. Air Force Rescue Heroes.

title: The Unit Scholarship Fund
content: Provides merit-based scholarships to the dependents of current and former members assigned to a Special Operations unit within the United States Army Special Operations Command (USASOC) Fort Bragg, North Carolina.

title: VA Survivors' & Dependents' Educational Assistance
content: Provides education, training, certificate and on-the-job training for 45 months to eligible dependents and survivors of certain Veterans.

title: Wings Over America Scholarship Foundation
content: Provides college scholarships to dependent children and spouses of all Navy - officer and enlisted - Active Duty, retired or deceased who served within Naval Air Forces.

title: Army Scholarship Foundation
content: Provides college scholarships to the sons and daughters of those who served in the United States Army and to spouses of enlisted soldiers serving on active duty in the United States Army.

title: Military Spouse Corporate Career Network
content: Specializes in mentoring and employment placement solutions for military spouses, war wounded and caregivers of war wounded.

title: National Military Family Association - Spouse Employment
content: Provides information on getting started with finding a job, the federal hiring process, advantages military spouses might have when applying for certain jobs, and links to more military spouse employment Web sites.

title: Navy Fleet and Family Support Center
content: Find resources to assist Navy family members in job searches, resume building, interview tips, and career planning.

title: Operation RE/MAX
content: Access an employment recruitment program in the real estate industry targeting military spouses, retirees, injured Veterans and other ex-military personnel.

title: Joining Forces
content: White House program that asks Americans to get involved in supporting our military's needs in employment, education, wellness and public awareness. Learn how to get involved.

title: Military Spouse Employment Partnership
content: Search job listings across the country by title or location.

title: Family Counselor Fellowship for Military Spouses
content: Provides military spouses with the education necessary to enter the financial counseling career field.

title: Air Force Association (AFA) Spouse Scholarship
content: Encourages Air Force spouses worldwide to pursue associate/bachelor undergraduate or graduate/post-graduate degrees.

title: Armed Forces Communications & Electronics Association (AFCEA) Educational Foundation
content: Awards $2,000 scholarships to persons on Active Duty in the uniformed military services, Veterans and their spouses or dependents who are currently enrolled full time in an eligible degree program at an accredited 4-year college or university in the U.S.

title: Army Aviation Association of America Scholarships (AAAA)
content: Awards scholarships and interest-free loans annually to members of AAAA and their spouses, unmarried siblings, unmarried children, and unmarried grandchildren of current and deceased members. Some scholarships are specifically reserved for enlisted, warrant officer, company grade, and Department of the Army civilian members.

title: Chief Petty Officer Scholarship Fund
content: Gives funds to provide educational opportunities for spouses and children (natural born, adopted or step-children) of all Chief Petty Officers.

title: Coast Guard Exchange System Scholarship Program
content: Provides college scholarships to students who are dependents of Coast Guard Active Duty, Reserve and military retired members, current civilian NAF and APF employees and current Coast Guard Auxiliarists that meet eligibility requirements.

title: Dolphin Scholarship Foundation
content: Provides scholarship funding to assist children of the Submarine Force in attending colleges and universities.

title: EOD Memorial Foundation
content: Grants scholarships for students enrolled or planning to enroll full-time as an undergraduate in a U.S. accredited two year, four year, or vocational school. Applicant must be a family member, enrolled in DEERS, of an Active Duty, National Guard/Reserve, retired, or deceased Explosive Ordnance Disposal (EOD) Technician.

title: Folds of Honor Foundation
content: Provides educational scholarships for dependents and spouses of Service Members who were either killed or disabled while serving and defending our nation.

title: Hope for the Warriors
content: Provides financial assistance, wish grants, spousal scholarship, transitional adaptive housing through the Warrior House program, and a support group for families.

title: John A. Keller Scholarship
content: Offers scholarships to dependents of members in the Chief Warrant and Warrant Officers Association who are high school seniors or attending college.

title: Ladies Auxiliary of the Fleet Reserve Association
content: Offers the LA Fleet Reserve, Sam Rose and the Allie Mae Oden Memorial Scholarships to the spouse, dependents and grandchildren of Active Duty Fleet Reserve family members.

title: Liberty University's Heroes Fund Scholarship
content: Offered to Service Members, Veterans and their survivors who were wounded in Operations Desert Storm, Enduring Freedom, or Iraqi Freedom. Call 1-800-424-9595. Click here for the Heroes Fund Scholarship Application.

title: Marine Corps - Law Enforcement Foundation, Inc.
content: Provides financial assistance for scholarships and health care to children of Marines or federal law enforcement personnel who were killed on duty or died under extraordinary circumstances while serving our country at home or abroad.

title: Marine Corps League - Scholarship Program
content: Awards scholarships to the children and grandchildren of Marines who have lost their lives in service to their country and to children and grandchildren of members of the Marine Corps League and its Ladies Auxiliary.

title: Marine Corps Scholarship Foundation
content: Provides financial assistance in the form of scholarships to children of current or former Marines pursuing higher education at accredited universities and colleges or vocational schools.

title: Military Order of the Purple Heart's Scholarship Program
content: Offers competitive scholarships to members, spouses, widows, dependents and grandchildren of the Military Order of the Purple Heart.

title: Military Spouse Fellowship Program for Financial Counseling
content: Find information on a special fellowship and accredited program for military spouses interested in a career as a financial counselor.

title: Military Spouse Program at Excelsior College
content: Offers spouses of Service Members distance education opportunities at reduced rates for undergraduate studies. Spouses of wounded warriors who can demonstrate a financial need may apply for the Military Scholarship Program.

title: National Military Family Association - Military Spouse Scholarship Program
content: Awards scholarships to spouses of uniformed Service Members (Active Duty, National Guard and Reserve, retirees and survivors) to obtain professional certification or to attend post secondary or graduate school. Scholarships range in amount from $500 to $1,000 and may be used for tuition, fees and school room and board.

title: Naval Special Warfare Scholarships
content: Grants scholarships to children and spouses of Active Duty SEALs or SWCC (Special Warfare Combatant Crewmen) who are starting college or continuing college, full-time or part-time, with the goal of graduating with an Associate's or a Bachelor's degree.

title: Navy League of the United States Scholarship Program
content: Provides financial assistance to the dependents and direct descendants of sea service personnel for college and university expenses.

title: Navy Supply Corps Foundation Scholarship Program
content: Provides financial assistance for undergraduate studies to family members (child, grandchild or spouse) of a qualifying Supply Corps officer or supply enlisted member.  Includes a Memorial Scholarship program for children of Supply Corps officers who have died on active duty since 2001.

title: Navy Wives Clubs of America (NWCA) - Scholarships
content: Provides information on scholarships for NWCA members and children of enlisted members of the Navy, Marine Corps and Coast Guard.

title: Navy-Marine Corps Relief Society Education Programs
content: Provides members of the Navy and Marine Corps and eligible family members and survivors with needs-based scholarships and interest-free loans for educational purposes.

title: Operation Mom
content: Offers support to the military, their families and those who support them by providing care packages to deployed troops, letters of encouragement, emergency funds for injured military and scholarships for dependents.

title: Paralyzed Veterans of America Scholarship
content: Offers scholarships to PVA members and their families so that they may achieve their educational goals.

title: Patriot Foundation
content: Provides the Unit Scholarship Fund that educates children of 82nd Airborne soldiers killed in Iraq /Afghanistan and children of current, retired and former Army Special Operations soldiers.

title: Ranger Memorial Foundation Scholarship Fund
content: Grants up to 25 annual $1,000 competitive scholarships to Army Rangers and their dependents.

title: Scholarship for Graphic & Web Design Careers
content: Offers the Louis H. Schilt Memorial Scholarship to spouses of Service Members injured in the line of duty who are interested in pursuing a career in graphic or Web design. All required supplies, including state-of-the-art Apple iMac computers and Adobe Creative Suite software, are provided to scholarship recipients at no cost.

title: Scholarship for Military Aviators
content: Encourages young men and women to become military pilots through scholarships that provide funding for pursuing a career as a military aviator, a military career through a Navy, Army or Air Force ROTC program and funds programs for high school students who are interested in flying.

title: Scholarships for Military Children
content: Awarded to children of Active Duty personnel, Reserve/National Guard and retired military members or survivors of deceased members.

title: Society of the First Infantry Division - Scholarships & Grants
content: Provides scholarships for children of soldiers killed while serving in combat with the Division and in peacetime training accidents, and for children and grandchildren of former members of the Division. Also provides emergency assistance grants for airfare, housing and other needs.

title: Special Operations Warrior Foundation College Scholarship
content: Offers college scholarships, financial aid and educational counseling for children of Army, Navy, Air Force and Marine Corps Special Operations personnel who were killed in an operational mission or training accident.

title: Tailhook Education Foundation
content: Provides undergraduate educational scholarships to spouses and dependents of Service Members who serve or formerly served in the Navy as Naval aviators, flight officers, air crewmen, or as carrier aviation air wing or company personnel.

title: ThanksUSA Scholarship Program
content: Offers college scholarship to the spouses and dependent children, age 24 and under, of Active-Duty Service Members.

title: That Others May Live Scholarships
content: Provides scholarships, family counseling and aid to the surviving children of the U.S. Air Force Rescue Heroes.

title: Tillman Military Scholarships
content: Provides financial assistance for tuition, fees, books, housing and childcare to support Veterans, Service Members, spouses and dependents completing degrees or certificate programs.

title: VA Survivors' & Dependents' Educational Assistance (SDEA)
content: Education and training opportunities for eligible dependents of certain Veterans. May be used for degree and certificate programs, apprenticeship and on-the-job training. See fact sheet on VA SDEA program.

title: Wings Over America Scholarship Foundation
content: Provides college scholarships to dependent children and spouses of all Navy - officer and enlisted - Active Duty, retired or deceased who served within Naval Air Forces.

title: Women's Army Corps Veterans Association Scholarship
content: Offers $1,500 scholarship to the relatives of Army Service Women.  This scholarship is based upon academic achievement and leadership as expressed through curricular activities and community involvement.

title: The Entrepreneurship Bootcamp for Veterans' Families
content: Integrates small business training with family and caregiver challenges in order to help caregivers of Veterans or surviving family members start a small business.

title: Army National Guard (ARNG) GI - Deployment Support for Families
content: Find information for ARNG families before, during and after deployments on programs including: ARNG 101, America's Adopt a Soldier, Dealing with Deployment, Family Assistance Centers, Family Readiness Groups, the Yellow Ribbon Program, Preparing for Deployment, Resilience and much more.

title: America's Child - Higher Education Assistance
content: Offers higher educational assistance for the children of our military heroes by providing tuition assistance, books, supplies and other higher educational expenses to enrolled students at accredited two- and four-year colleges, universities and recognized trade schools.

title: 1st Marine Division Association Scholarship Fund
content: Provides grants of up to $1,750 for full-time students who are the dependents of deceased or totally and permanently disabled members of the association.

title: Military Children's Scholarship Handbook
content: Contains all the latest information about getting a college degree.

title: Air Force Aid Society (AFAS) Education and Grants
content: Provides need-based academic grants to children of Active Duty, Reserve, retired and deceased Air Force members.

title: Air Force Association (AFA) Scholarships & Grants
content: Learn about awards, scholarships and grants offered by the AFA, a civilian education organization that works to promote public understanding and appreciation of the role of aerospace power in national defense.

title: Air Force Sergeants Association & Airmen Memorial Foundation
content: Provides college grants and other financial assistance to children and spouses of service members killed in Iraq or Afghanistan, as well as to the families of service members disabled in these wars.

title: American Legion Legacy Scholarship
content: Provides scholarships for children of active duty military, Guard and Reserve personnel who died on active duty on or after September 11, 2001.

title: Armed Forces Children's Education Fund
content: Provides financial assistance to the surviving children of service members killed on or after October 7, 2001 as part of Operation Enduring Freedom in Afghanistan. Qualifications and an application for the scholarship.

title: Army Aviation Association of America
content: Supports Army Aviation soldiers and families with financial assistance for college-level education of members and spouses, unmarried siblings, unmarried children and unmarried grandchildren of current and deceased members.

title: Army Emergency Relief Scholarship Program
content: Provides scholarships to children and spouses of active duty, retired or deceased soldiers.

title: Chief Warrant & Warrant Officers Association
content: Offers various Benefits, including health and life insurance, a scholarship for members' children and recreation and travel benefits.

title: Children of Fallen Soldiers Relief Fund
content: Provides college grants and other financial assistance to children and spouses of service members killed in Iraq or Afghanistan, as well as to the families of service members disabled in these wars.

title: Dolphin Scholarship Foundation
content: Access a scholarship fund to assist children of the Submarine Force in attending colleges and universities.

title: National Military Family Association - Spouse Education
content: Learn about the National Military Family Association's resources for spouses and children of Service Members.

title: Federal Benefits for Veterans & Dependents
content: Learn about VA health care, disability compensation, education and training, home loan guaranty, financial assistance, life insurance and more.

title: Folds of Honor Foundation
content: Provides educational scholarships for dependents and spouses of Service Members who were either killed or disabled while serving and defending our nation.

title: Homefront America, Inc.
content: Supports families through financial assistance, holiday programs, scholarships and children-oriented programs.

title: Jesse Brown Memorial Youth Scholarship Program
content: Awards educational scholarships to individuals age 21 or younger that have volunteered for a minimum of 100 hours at a Department of Veterans Affairs (VA) medical center during the previous calendar year.

title: Marine Corps - Law Enforcement Foundation, Inc.
content: Provides financial assistance for scholarships and health care to children of Marines or federal law enforcement personnel who were killed on duty or died under extraordinary circumstances while serving our country at home or abroad.

title: Marine Corps Scholarship Fund
content: Provides financial assistance in the form of scholarships for higher education to sons and daughters of Marines and children of former Marines, with particular attention being given to children whose parent was killed or wounded in action.

title: Military Officers Association of America Scholarship Fund
content: Provides educational assistance for children of military families.

title: Navy League of the United States Scholarship Program
content: Offers college scholarships based on need and academic achievement to children of current and former members of the Navy.

title: Navy Supply Corps Foundation - Scholarship Program
content: Provides financial assistance for undergraduate studies to family members (child, grandchild or spouse) of a qualifying Supply Corps officer or supply enlisted member. Includes a Memorial Scholarship program for children of Supply Corps officers who have died on active duty since 2001.

title: Navy-Marine Corps Relief Society Scholarship Program
content: Provides educational assistance for children and unremarried spouses of deceased Service Members.

title: Operation Mom
content: Offers support to the military, their families and those who support them by providing care packages to deployed troops, letters of encouragement, emergency funds for injured military and scholarships for dependents.

title: Patriot Guard Riders Fallen Warrior Scholarship
content: Provides financial assistance in the form of scholarships to U.S. military family members of our Fallen Warriors in their pursuit of higher education. One-year scholarships of $2000 are awarded annually, and are limited to undergraduate studies at accredited educational/technical institutions.

title: Scholarships for Military Children
content: Awarded to children of Active Duty personnel, Reserve/National Guard and retired military members or survivors of deceased members.

title: Special Operations Warrior Foundation
content: Provides college scholarships for children of Army, Navy, Air Force and Marine Corps Special Operations personnel killed in an operational mission or training accident.

title: Survivors' & Dependents' Educational Assistance
content: Provides eligibility, application, benefit period and payment limit information for eligible spouses and children of certain Veterans who can receive benefits for education, training and testing.

title: ThanksUSA Scholarship Program
content: Offers college scholarship to the spouses and dependent children, age 24 and under, of Active-Duty Service Members.

title: That Others May Live Scholarships
content: Provides scholarships, family counseling and aid to the surviving children of the U.S. Air Force Rescue Heroes.

title: The Unit Scholarship Fund
content: Provides merit-based scholarships to the dependents of current and former members assigned to a Special Operations unit within the United States Army Special Operations Command (USASOC) Fort Bragg, North Carolina.

title: Veterans of Foreign Wars (VFW) Scholarship Programs
content: Participate in the Voice of Democracy Scholarship Competition and the Patriot's Pen Essay Contest, garnering more than $3.4 million in scholarships and incentives.

title: Wings Over America Scholarship Foundation
content: Provides college scholarships to dependent children and spouses of all Navy - officer and enlisted - Active Duty, retired or deceased who served within Naval Air Forces.

title: Joining Forces
content: White House program that asks Americans to get involved in supporting our military's needs in employment, education, wellness and public awareness. Learn how to get involved.

title: Seabee Memorial Scholarship Association
content: Provides educational assistance for full-time study to children and grandchildren of Seabees.

title: Military Family Support Trust
content: Helps high school seniors obtain college scholarships and eligible individuals and their families meet critical unexpected financial needs in areas such as personal care, housing and all aspects of health care.

title: Military OneSource Child Care Information
content: Offers programs that provide child care for members of the military and their families.

title: Armed Services YMCA of the USA
content: Offers essential programs such as child care, hospital assistance and spouse support to military families.

title: Child Care Resources for Parents
content: Provides links to help in choosing and paying for a child care provider and includes information on health and safety regulations in each state.

title: Coast Guard Family Child Care Program & Resources
content: Learn about the Family Child Care Program, which enables spouses or other family members of Coast Guard members to operate a child care business in their homes.

title: Easter Seals
content: Offers a variety of services, including child development centers, medical rehabilitation programs, job training, respite care, recreation and camping to help people with disabilities address life's challenges and achieve personal goals.

title: Marine Corps Child Care Programs
content: Learn about Marine Corps child care programs, and find child care services in your area.

title: National Association of Child Care Resource & Referral Agencies - Military Child Care in Your Neighborhood
content: Provides resources to help you find quality child care in your area. Offers subsidies when a non-military spouse is attending school, working, or looking for work.

title: Military Child Development & Youth Programs
content: Offers child development centers, in-home child care, school-age programs, youth programs, and resource and referral services.

title: Navy-Marine Corps Relief Society Financial Assistance
content: Provides interest-free loans or grants to help with emergency needs such as transportation, vehicle repairs, funeral expenses, medical bills, food, rent, utilities and child care expenses.

title: Operation: Military Child Care (OMCC)
content: Provides child care fee assistance for National Guard and Reserve families whose children are enrolled in non-DoD-licensed child care facilities. Also provides child care fee assistance for Active Duty families whose children are enrolled in non-DoD-licensed child care facilities.

title: Questions to Ask About Military Child Care Waiting Lists and Costs
content: Provides tips for finding the best child care provider for your family, including questions to ask about care, waiting lists, and child care costs.

title: Military Families - Foster & Adoptive Parents
content: Find information from the Department of Health and Human Services for military parents who are interested in adopting or fostering children.

title: U.S. Department of Agriculture Extension/4-H Support for Military Youth & Family Programs
content: Provide quality educational experiences to military youth in photography, arts, computer technology and citizenship for military youth ages 5-19 on nearly every Army and Air Force installation world wide. 4-H clubs are also available to military youth living off post as well as youth of National Guard and Reserve families.

title: Free Respite Child Care for Soldiers
content: Information about a program through which families may get up to 16 hours of free child care each month for each eligible child.

title: Child Care Subsidy for Dependents of Severely Injured Military Members
content: Works with DoD to help provide families of severely injured military members with assistance to find and pay for safe, licensed child care services for a period of six months during their period of recuperation. Offers several publications in English and Spanish on choosing quality child care.

title: Coast Guard Child Care Subsidy Rates
content: Organizes Coast Guard child care subsidy program tuition rates and benefits in easy-to-read charts.

title: Military OneSource Child Care Cost Information
content: Find information on military child care fees, how fees are determined, what subsidized care is, and how waiting lists work.

title: Get Help Paying for Child Care
content: Provides information on NACCRRA's child care subsidy program and instructions on applying for child care funds.

title: Navy Safe Harbor Case Management
content: Assigns a care professional to help sailors and Coast Guardsmen identify short- and long-term goals and develop plans to achieve them. Also anticipates and addresses the day-to-day non-medical needs of enrolled Service Members and their families and works to resolve any problems that arise during recovery.

title: Sittercity Childcare Program for All Service Members
content: Find sitters and military subsidized care providers, including elder care companions, dog walkers, housekeepers and tutors. Your membership is funded by the DoD.

title: VFW National Home for Children
content: Offers a safety net for military families when a family care plan fails, supportive services for Veterans with children who are approved for VA Vocational Rehabilitation, a chance for Veteran-related single-parent families to get a fresh start and a loving home for Veteran-related children who need it. Call the National Home Helpline at 1-800-313-4200 if you need help with supportive services and resources in your own community or if you are seeking a referral to an on-campus program.

title: Military Families Learning Network - Child Care
content:
Provides support to Service Members and their families through engaged online communities providing best practices, information, educational and curriculum materials, and  programming activities and efforts.
The primary concentration areas for the Military Families Learning Network  are personal finance, child care, family development and network literacy.

title: Good Grief Camp
content: Operated by the Tragedy Assistance Program for Survivors, these camps offer children and teens a safe and supportive atmosphere to conduct activities and have opportunities to learn coping skills, establish and identify support systems and create awareness that they are not alone in the grief of their loved one. View a camp calendar.

title: Operation Ensuring Christmas
content: Provides financial, moral and rehabilitative support to the children of fallen American troops by providing them Christmas Gift Cards at Christmas and a Christmas in July, VIP theme park trip to Orlando, Florida.

title: CAMP C.O.P.E.
content: Provides recreational activities for children of injured or deployed Service Members or Veterans, and provides interactive small group counseling for children.

title: Boys & Girls Clubs of America (BGCA) Youth Centers
content: Works to promote and enhance self-worth and development in boys and girls through a variety of programs and services.  Includes information on "Youth Centers"which are formed through partnerships between BGCA and the military to provide outreach to children of service members.

title: Comfort Zone Camp
content: Camps for children ages 7-17 who have experienced the death of a close loved one.

title: Homefront America, Inc.
content: Supports families through financial assistance, holiday programs, scholarships and children-oriented programs.

title: Military & Family Life Consultants (MFLC) Child & Youth Services (CYS) Program
content: Clinical consultants augment child behavioral services by mentoring and addressing short-term problem resolution such as school issues, deployment and reunion adjustments, and parent-child communications.

title: Military Family Network
content: Connects military families with their communities and organizations that can help them. Includes a job bank and a Web page called Online Fun for Military Children.

title: National Military Family Association Children & Youth Information
content: Provides information and resources for military children and their families including Web sites, book selections, letter writing campaigns and research dealing with children and deployments.

title: Operation Purple - Free Summer Camps for Military Kids
content: Provides free summer camps for military children who have or will experience deployment.

title: Our Military Kids
content: Provides grants for children (3 years - 12th grade) of deployed National Guard and Reserve Service Members and the children of ALL Wounded Warriors to participate in youth sports, fine arts, camps and tutoring programs.

title: Speak Out for Military Kids
content: Trains military and non-military youth to establish Speakers Bureaus to advocate for military-connected youth affected by deployment.

title: U.S. Department of Agriculture Extension/4-H Support for Military Youth & Family Programs
content: Provide quality educational experiences to military youth in photography, arts, computer technology and citizenship for military youth ages 5-19 on nearly every Army and Air Force installation world wide. 4-H clubs are also available to military youth living off post as well as youth of National Guard and Reserve families.

title: Operation Military Kids
content: Provides information on the U.S. Army's collaborative effort with America's communities to support children and youth impacted by deployment. Includes recreational, social and educational programs, state level initiatives, camp activities, mentorship, assistance with school issues and more.

title: Blue Star Museums
content: Learn about this collaborative program of the National Endowment of the Arts and Blue Star Families that offers free admission to museums for all active duty military personnel and their families during the summer.

title: 4-H Military Partnerships
content: Support positive youth development education for youth whose parents are serving in the military through formal partnerships with Army Child, Youth and School Services, Air Force Airman and Family Services, and Navy Family Readiness. Youth learned new life skills and gained self confidence through their participatin in these Military 4-H Clubs.

title: Ketia 4 Kidz Foundation
content: Created to motivate children of active duty, deployed and severely injured military personnel to achieve their goals through excellence in academics, arts and sports-related programs. Offers various sports activities, adopt-a-school program, scholarship program and other activities.

title: Horses4Heroes
content: Offers horseback riding programs for the families of military  personnel (active duty and veterans), law enforcement officers,  firefighters and EMTs, pediatric, critical care and hospice nurses, and  special needs school teachers at more than 150 facilities across the country.

title: Military Warriors Support Foundation - Skills4Life
content: Provide family mentorings and recreational outings such as hunting, fishing, golf, sporting events, family outings and vacations.

title: 1st Marine Division Association Scholarship Fund
content: Provides grants of up to $1,750 for full-time students who are the dependents of deceased or totally and permanently disabled members of the association.

content: Contains all the latest information about getting a college degree.

content: Provides information on scholarships for NWCA members and children of enlisted members of the Navy, Marine Corps and Coast Guard. Includes links to application materials.

content: Provides educational assistance for children and unremarried spouses of deceased Service Members.

content: Offers support to the military, their families and those who support them by providing care packages to deployed troops, letters of encouragement, emergency funds for injured military and scholarships for dependents.

content: Provides financial assistance in the form of scholarships to U.S. military family members of our Fallen Warriors in their pursuit of higher education. title: Scholarships for Military Children
content: Awarded to children of Active Duty personnel, Reserve/National Guard and retired military members or survivors of deceased members.

content: Provides college scholarships for children of Army, Navy, Air Force and Marine Corps Special Operations personnel killed in an operational mission or training accident.

content: Provides eligibility, application, benefit period and payment limit information for eligible spouses and children of certain Veterans who can receive benefits for education, training and testing.

content: Offers college scholarship to the spouses and dependent children, age 24 and under, of Active-Duty Service Members.

content: Provides scholarships, family counseling and aid to the surviving children of the U.S. Air Force Rescue Heroes.
