title: Naval Support Activity Saratoga Springs Relocation Assistance
content: Find out how to survive the "mobile lifestyle" and how to reduce the stress involved with your move. Attend a "Smooth Move" class at the Fleet and Family Support Center to learn your entitlements and other tools to make your move as smooth as possible.

title: Naval Support Activity Saratoga Springs Fleet & Family Support Center
content: Offers programs and services to Navy and non-Navy Service Members and their families. One of these services, Information and Referral, assists Service Members and families find more information on DoD and local community resources. Programs offered on base include: the Family Advocacy Program, Exceptional Family Member Program, Family Readiness Groups, Deployment Readiness, New Parent Support and more.

title: Access NYC
content: Provides a free online directory of New York government and non-government services and programs, including the ability to apply for the School Meals program.

title: Help Base Greater Rochester
content: Provides information on local community organizations that offer services to Veterans, Service Members and their families in the Greater Rochester area.

title: Operation Homefront of New York & New Jersey
content: Provides emergency financial and other assistance to Service Members, Veterans and their families to help support their urgent household needs.

title: Ontario County Temporary Assistance
content: Learn about the county's family support programs and their eligibility requirements. The Family Assistance and the Safety Net Programs provide temporary cash support to those who are living below the poverty level. The Temporary Assistance unit also manages the federal Food Stamp Program and the Home Energy Assistance program (HEAP).

title: Nassau County Day Care
content: Provides child care not only to those on temporary assistance, but also to those working families who meet income guidelines for subsidies. Various kinds of child care are available throughout Nassau County. To obtain more information call the application unit at (516) 227-7976.

title: Nassau County Temporary Assistance
content: Offers various county and state programs that helps families in need temporarily due to an emergency circumstance or for economic reasons.

title: Tioga County Social Services Department
content: Learn about county programs that provide temporary assistance including: food stamps, Medicaid, cash grants, Home Energy Assistance Program (HEAP) and managed care.

title: Allegany County Temporary Service Division
content: Find information on programs and services that include: employment, medical care, nutrition, financial, emergency assistance, supportive services, Home Energy Assistance Program (HEAP) and more.

title: Suffolk County Women, Infants & Children (WIC) Program
content: Provides supplemental foods, nutrition and health education plus health and human services referrals to income eligible pregnant, breastfeeding, postpartum women, infants and children up to 5 years of age who are at nutritional risk. Find information on locations and hours for WIC offices in Suffolk County.

title: Albany County Property Tax Exemptions for Veterans & Gold Star Parents
content: Learn about this special tax exemption and required eligibility and documents necessary to apply.

title: Rensselaer County Domestic Violence Program
content: Offers an anonymous 24-hour domestic violence hotline, which provides crisis intervention, information and referrals. Collect calls accepted at (518) 272-2370. The Unity House of Troy - Families in Crisis Program prrovides counseling, legal support and emergency shelter. Call (518) 272-5917 for more information.

title: Rensselaer County Food Stamp Program
content: Learn about eligibility and how to apply for the local food stamp program. Access contact information and hours for this county office.

title: Renesselaer County Temporary Assistance Program
content: Provides cash assistance to needy families that include a minor child living with a parent (including families where both parents are in the household) or a caretaker relative.

title: Albany Sexual Assault Victim Support & Hotline
content: Offers information and confidential counseling to victims of sexual assault and to their families and friends. Call the free hotline 24 hours a day at (518) 447-7716.

title: Albany County Food Stamp Program
content: Learn about program guidelines and eligibility along with contact and hours information for the office.

title: Fort Drum School Liaison Office
content: Assists military families with registering for new schools and advocates for the families needs for issues such as new orders, relocation and deployment-related needs.

title: Fort Drum Child & Youth Services
content: Learn about the child and youth programs offered at Fort Drum and how to register for them including: full day, part day and hourly child care, before and after school programs, sports and activities for middle school and high school students.

title: West Point Family & Morale, Welfare & Recreation (FMWR)
content: Find links for Army Community Service, dining and lodging, recreation and leisure, child and youth services and special events and attractions for Service Members and families stationed on or near West Point.

title: Oneida County Temporary Assistance Program
content: Determines and monitors eligibility for Temporary Assistance (family assistance and safety net assistance) and such programs as food stamps, Medicaid, emergency aid and the Home Energy Assistance Program. Receive help applying for benefits including: child support, daycare and safe affordable housing. Emergency Assistance is available to help those households in a crisis situation even though they may be ineligible for ongoing assistance.

title: Nassau County Food Stamps Program
content: Helps low-income households by supplementing their monthly food budget.  Eligible households use an electronic benefit card and PIN (personal ID number) to access their benefits at the supermarket checkout counter, the same way a debit card is used.

title: Greene County Food Stamp Program
content: Learn about the food stamp program including eligibility, where to pick up food stamps and contact information.

title: Greene County Temporary Assistance
content: Provides temporary assistance through cash grants for needs including: food and clothing, rent and mortgage, food and utilities, pregnancy and emergency repairs or evictions.

title: FAVOR - Veterans Discount Card Program - Westchester County, New York
content: Offers discounts by local businesses on goods and services to honorably discharged Veterans in Westchester County, New York. Available anywhere county parks passes are issued.

title: Schuyler County Temporary Assistance
content: Provides short-term help to families and individuals as they work toward self-sufficiency. If you are unable to work, can't find a job, or your job does not pay enough to meet your basic needs, Temporary Assistance may be able to help you pay expenses. Eligibility for Family Assistance and Safety Net Assistance is determined based on income, resources and cooperation with all required actions.

title: Yates County Temporary Assistance
content: Learn about county and state-level temporary assistance programs including: family assistance, food stamps, Safety Net Assistance, Home Energy Assistance Program (HEAP) and child care services.

title: Ontario County Child Day Care
content: Provides child day care assistance to all eligible children through programs that include: Temporary Assistance for Needy Families, low-income, at risk, protective and preventive child day care.

title: Ontario County Food Stamp Program
content: Learn about the county's Food Stamp Program including eligibility and locations. Individuals and families receiving public assistance, as well as non-public assistance families are eligible to apply.

title: Fort Drum Families Program
content: Find links for the Family Readiness Group (FRG), deployment support, local community information, the Family Readiness Assistance Program, Chaplain services and more.

title: Fort Drum Soldier & Family Assistance Center
content: Provides a supportive environment for soldiers and family members as they deal with the stress and uncertainty of injury and the effects of war. Provides services on-site and on a part-time basis and establishes priority appointments for warriors and their family members in transition.

title: West Point Child, Youth & School Services Office
content: Find information and links for the Parent Central Outreach Service, Child Development Centers, School Age Services, Youth Centers, sports, the Army School Liaison, child care and special programs.

title: Peninsula Counseling Center
content: Provides a wide range of mental health services and programs for children, adolescents, adults and seniors.

title: NYS Gold Star Parent Annuity
content: Authorizes an annuity payment of up to $500 per Gold Star Parent of a deceased Veteran.

title: NYS Regents Awards
content: Awards up to $450 per year to students whose parent(s) served in the U.S. Armed Forces during specified times of national emergency.

title: Project New Hope
content: Provides free retreats in a camp-like setting for Veterans and their families.

title: Wyoming County Temporary Assistance Program
content: Learn about the Temporary Assistance Program offered by the county and eligibility requirements. If you are unable to work, can't find a job, or have a job that doesn't pay enough to meet your basic needs, Temporary Assistance may be able to help you by meeting such needs as rent, heat and utilities.

title: Genesee County Department of Social Services
content: Find information on social services offered in Genesee County including financial assistance, food stamps, day care and more.

title: Operation Military Kids - New York
content: Provides support to Army installations and geographically dispersed military youth who are affected by the global war on terrorism.

title: New York State Division of Veterans Affairs
content: Provides quality service and advocacy for New York Veterans, Armed Forces members, their dependents and survivors, ensuring they receive benefits granted by law for their service.

title: New York State Summary of VA Programs & Services
content: Describes the full range of VA programs, benefits and services available to Veterans and their families in New York.  Download the VA's New York fact sheet.

title: Warren County Women, Infant & Children (WIC) Program
content: Provides nutrition assessments, nutrition education and counseling, as well as referrals and vouchers for healthy foods to pregnant, breastfeeding and postpartum women, infants and children up to age five.

title: West Point Survivor Outreach Services (SOS)
content: Provides long-term support, resources and emotional connections by maintaining a continual relationship between Survivors and the Army. SOS is available to all Survivors: spouses, children, parents, siblings and friends who are grieving the loss of a Soldier regardless of how they died. All Army, Army National Guard and Army Reserve component Survivors are eligible to participate.

title: Niagara County Department of Social Services
content: Find information on local social service programs including: food stamps, cash assistance, medical assistance, medical transportation, child services, nursing homes, adult services, employment services, day care and the Home Energy Assistance Program.

title: Oneida County Food Stamps Program
content: Provides supplemental assistance to low-income households so they can obtain low cost nutritious meals. Benefits are provided through an Electronic Benefit Transfer (EBT), which is used like a "debit" card.

title: Seneca County Temporary Assistance
content: Provides the address, hours and basic information for programs including: food stamps, cash assistance, Medicaid, Home Energy Assistance Program (HEAP) and emergency aid to families.

title: Livingston County Department of Social Services
content: Learn about the programs and services offered for low-income families and emergency situations such as food stamps, day care, temporary financial assistance and more. Also includes hours, contact information and some eligibility requirements.

title: Washington County Women, Infant & Children (WIC) Program
content: Provides nutritious foods, nutrition, health education and referrals to health and human service providers for all eligible families within Washington County.

title: Rensselaer County Day Care
content: Provides a block grant to states for child care assistance to help low-income working families, families receiving public assistance and those enrolled in training or education become and remain independent.

title: St. Lawrence County Temporary Assistance
content: Provides financial assistance to families to meet basic needs such as food, shelter and fuel. Families that qualify for temporary assistance may also receive food stamps, Medicaid and the Home Energy Assistance Program.

title: St. Lawrence County Food Stamp Program
content: Learn about the county food stamp program including walk-in hours, automated system, eligibility and more.

title: Essex County Food Stamp Program
content: Learn about the federally funded supplemental program which issues monthly benefits. Food stamp benefits are used to purchase food items and are redeemed when you use your electronic benefit card. Most food stores accept the CBIC/EBT card. Look for the Quest sign on the door or window of the store.

title: Veterans Outreach Center
content: Provides comprehensive outreach to Veterans and their families along with services needed to help Veterans regain mental, physical and economic health, reconnect with themselves and the community and resume productive lives.  Programs include benefit counseling, employment assistance and training, financial counseling and housing assistance.

title: Fisher House Comfort Homes - New York
content: Provides free temporary housing for families of patients receiving medical care at major military and VA medical centers in New York.

title: Parent Help
content: Offers confidential, free advice in English and Spanish on parenting, divorce child support and mediations.

title: Naval Support Activity Saratoga Springs Morale, Welfare & Recreation
content: Provides sports fields, fitness facilities, outdoor recreation equipment, event tickets and group trips for Service Members and families attached to Saratoga Springs.

title: Fort Hamilton Relocation Services
content: Find information about Army Community Services, scheduled briefings, deployment support, foreign-born spouse support, emergency and transition assistance. These services are available to the Service Member and their dependents.

title: Fort Hamilton Childcare
content: Find general and registration information on education resources for your children, the child development center, school-aged services, and child and youth services.

title: Fort Hamilton Local Public School Information
content: Find information on New York City schools for children of all ages along with helpful tips to make your transition to Fort Hamilton easier.

title: Fort Hamilton Morale, Welfare & Recreation (MWR)
content: Find information on services and resources that include recreation and fun as well as services and referrals for emergencies and tough times.

title: Family of Heroes - Resiliency & PTSD Training Simulation for Veteran Families
content: A 1-hour role-playing resiliency training simulation where family members learn essential skills to manage the challenges they may face in adjusting to post-deployment life. The training is currently available online, for free, to all Veteran families in New York City, Long Island, the Lower Hudson Valley and New Jersey.

title: Division of Child Care Services - New York
content: Provides resources to help parents with child care needs and people who want to start a child care program. Find local day care centers in New York.

title: NYU Langone Medical Center Military Family Clinic
content: Treats a variety of issues for individuals, children, adolescents, couples, and families of primarily OIF/OEF Service Members and Veterans.

title: Clear Path for Veterans
content: Offers a variety of support programs for veterans and their families.

title: Homeward Bound Adirondacks
content: Leads a series of trainings and retreats for Veterans, professionals and community members including the Veterans Reintegration Academy. Part of the Community Blueprint Network.

geographicServiceLocations.address: P.O. Box 1100, Saranac Lake, New York 12983

title: Autism Society - Hudson Valley Chapter
content: Works to improve services for people with autism spectrum disorders (ASD) and their families through education, advocacy and public awareness. Advocates for services for individuals and provides information regarding treatment, education and research.

title: New York Families for Autistic Children
content: Helps individuals, parents and professionals find resources, support and training while working to increase the awareness of autism spectrum disorders (ASD) and advocating for the needs of individuals with autism and their families.

title: Global & Regional Asperger Syndrome Partnership
content: Provides information on improving the lives of people on the autism spectrum through community outreach, peer support, education and advocacy.

title: NYSARC - The ARC of New York
content: Provides support, information, direction and services for people with intellectual and developmental disabilities. Find local chapters of the ARC in New York.

title: North Carolina Division of Aging & Adult Services
content: Helps older North Carolina residents to be as independent as possible for as long as possible through advocacy, development and delivery of policies, programs and services which support and empower the elderly and their families.

title: Family Caregiver Alliance - North Carolina State Profile
content: Provides background characteristics for North Carolina related to caregiving and aging as well as information on publicly-funded caregiver support programs.

title: Fort Bragg & Pope Air Force Base - Armed Services YMCA
content: Provides support services to military Service Members and their families, including child care, hospital assistance, spouse support services, food services, computer training classes, health and wellness services, and holiday meals, among many others.

title: Camp Lejeune Armed Services YMCA
content: Provides support services to military Service Members and their families, including child care, hospital assistance, spouse support services, food services, computer training classes, health and wellness services, and holiday meals, among many others.

title: Full Circle of Care
content: Offers information to families and caregivers in the State of North Carolina including where to turn for support and assistance as well as services for caregivers.

title: FOCUS Project: Family Resiliency Training for Military Families
content: Provides resiliency training for families and children facing the challenges of combat operational stress while loved ones are deployed. Learn about available assistance,, and find programs in California, Hawaii, Mississippi, North Carolina, Virginia, Washington and Okinawa.

title: Families Overcoming Under Stress Project (FOCUS)
content: Provides resiliency training for military families facing the challenges of a family member's deployment during wartime at Marine Corps Base Camp Lejeune. FOCUS uses family training techniques to highlight areas of strength and resilience in the family and promote family growth to help address current challenges.

title: Operation Homefront North Carolina
content: Provides emergency financial and other assistance to Service Members, Veterans and their families to help support their urgent household needs.

title: Marine Corps Cherry Point - New Parent Resources
content: Provides information on support groups for new parents. Find information on parenting classes, baby boot camp and home visits.

title: Apex Behavioral Healthcare, Inc.
content: Provides 24-hour residential rehabilitation treatment and mental, vocational and spiritual rehabilitation for male and female Veterans, including former incarcerated Veterans.

title: Army Family Readiness Groups (FRGs) in North Carolina
content: Provides a list of Army FRGs located in North Carolina, which provide a connection to unit information for spouses and other family members.

title: Military HOMEFRONT - North Carolina State Resources
content: Links to advocacy, employment, housing, health care, legal, financial and other resources available to Service Members, Veterans and families in the State of North Carolina.

title: North Carolina Department of Administration
content: Assists Veterans and their families in the presentation, processing, proof and establishment of claims, privileges, rights and benefits as they may be entitled to under federal, state or local laws.

title: Family Caregiver Alliance - North Carolina Caregiver Programs
content: Find information on programs funded through the National Family Caregiver Support Program, Aged/Disabled Medicaid waivers and state-funded programs that either have a caregiver-specific focus, or include a family caregiving component in their service package.

title: Operation Military Kids - North Carolina
content: Provides support to Army installations and geographically dispersed military youth who are affected by the global war on terrorism.

title: North Carolina State Summary of VA Programs & Services
content: Describes the full range of VA programs, benefits and services available to Veterans and their families in North Carolina.  Resources include information on health care facilities, counseling centers and vocational rehabilitation. Download the VA's North Carolina fact sheet.

title: North Carolina State Veterans' Cemetery Program
content: Provides a free burial plot at a North Carolina State Veterans' Cemetery for eligible North Carolina Veterans and their legal spouse (and dependents under certain conditions).

title: Steps & Stages: Women Veterans Resource Agency Inc.
content: Offers outreach, training, transitional housing, and reintegration services for female Veterans of all ages, stages and ranks. Call the 24-hour counseling hotline at 910-977-2303.

title: Seymour Johnson Air Force Base - Airman & Family Readiness
content: Provides individuals, families and leadership with programs and services that strengthen community and promote self-sufficiency, mission readiness and adaptation to the Air Force way of life. Programs include: career focus, employment readiness, family skills, the Airman Attic, financial management, Air Force Aid, relocation assistance, transition assistance and much more.

title: Seymour Johnson Air Force Base (SJAFB)- Youth Programs
content: Find information about youth programs for children and teens of Air Force Personnel stationed at SJAFB. Programs include after school care, sports and much more.

title: Seymour Johnson Air Force Base - Helpful Agencies
content: Find helpful information and contact numbers for Air Force families and personnel including: family advocacy, mental health services, school liaison officer, Sexual Assault Prevention and Response (SAPR) and Tricare referrals.

title: Camp Lejeune - Marine & Family Services
content: Find resources including: children, youth and teen programs, new parent support program, the Families Overcoming Under Stress (FOCUS) project resiliency training, counseling services and more.

title: Camp Lejeune - Military Housing Referral
content: Find information for Marine Corps housing for single and married Service Members that includes useful links and phone numbers for transferring personnel.

title: Camp Lejeune - Settling In
content: Find information for single and married Marine Corps personnel assigned to Camp Lejeune including: lodging and housing, household goods shipments, firearms registration, education and school and family support.

title: Fisher House Comfort Homes - North Carolina
content: Provides free temporary housing for families of patients receiving medical care at major military and VA medical centers in North Carolina.

title: Fort Bragg - Airborne Attic/Lending Closet
content: Loans household items to families PCSing to or from Fort Bragg.

title: Fort Bragg - School Age Services
content: Offers care and recreational programs for school age children before or after school.

title: Fort Bragg - Army Emergency Relief
content: Provides emergency financial assistance to soldiers and their families.

title: Fort Bragg - Relocation Readiness Program
content: Provides assistance to military personnel, DoD civilians, and family members moving to or from Fort Bragg. Includes information regarding housing, transportation, legal claims, EFMP, financial management, sponsorship and monthly pre-move briefings.

title: Camp Lejeune - Child & Youth Programs
content: Find information on programs available to children and teens. Access resources for child development programs, child care and teen programs.

title: Camp Lejeune - School Liason Information
content: Provides information on base schools, local and private schools and home schooling. Find resources for changing schools, registration and policies.

title: Seymour Johnson Air Force Base - School Information
content: Provides school information for military children. Find information about transitioning to a new school and a special needs checklist.

title: Marine Corps Air Station New River - Deployment Guide
content: Find information on all phases of deployment. Provides details on all programs to assist in a smooth deployment.

title: Fort Bragg - Family Readiness Information
content: Find information on the family readiness group, family readiness support assistant and FAQs. Learn how to register as a volunteer and the regulations for family readiness groups.

title: Camp Lejeune - Recreation Information
content: Find resources for recreation and leisure activities, sports and fitness, and education information. Access resources on family programs, single Marine programs, as well as lodging and dining.

title: Fort Bragg - Reserve Family Resources
content: Access resources to support active military and mobilized Reserve families. Find information on legal matters, school transition, money matters and wounded warrior programs.

title: Fort Bragg - Deployment Resources
content: Find resources for deployment and information on the mobilization and deployment program. This program provides active duty, Reserve and National Guard units with pre- and post-deployment/mobilization briefings, FRG assistance, information and referral services, resource materials and Operation R.E.A.D.Y. training.

title: Marine Corps Cherry Point - Family Care Programs
content: Find information on child development centers, child care and the community center. Learn about youth sports and activities for teens and children.

title: Marine Corps Cherry Point - Relocation Information
content: Find information on relocating, including a welcome packet and seminar.

title: Fort Bragg - Survivor Outreach Services (SOS)
content: Provides resources for survivors and their families. Find information on support for widows, widowers and family members who have suffered the loss of a soldier.

title: Seymour Johnson Air Force Base - Family Readiness Center
content: Find information on family programs, websites and important phone numbers.

title: Camp Lejeune - Counseling Services
content: Provides information on counseling services. Find information on suicide awareness and prevention, along with links to related topics.

title: Camp Lejeune - New Parent Programs
content: Access resources for new parents. Find information for support groups, baby boot camp, classes, well baby clinics and related links.

title: Fort Bragg - Resiliency Services
content: Learn about resiliency services and programs for families and soldiers, including Warrior Adventure Quest and other outdoor fitness programs.

title: Marine Corps Cherry Point - Family Readiness Program
content: Provides information on family readiness command team, family readiness officer, and training.

title: Camp Lejeune - Family Readiness Program
content: Find information on family readiness programs, the family readiness officer, and how to get involved. Provides links to other resources that are helpful for family members.

title: Fort Bragg - Family & Child Resources
content: Provides resources for family support, child care and school information. Access information on family and new parent support, as well as deployment readiness.

title: Fort Bragg - Recreation Information
content: Provides information on recreation, fitness, equipment checkout and travel. Find information on the warrior adventure quest and outdoor activities.

title: CREDO - Camp Lejeune
content: Information on the Navy Chaplain Corps' marriage and single person resiliency retreats.  Includes personal and spiritual growth retreats, teen retreats, marriage enrichment workshops and unit team building. Programs are free and require advance registration.

title: Fort Bragg - Parent & Outreach Services
content: Offers a variety of programs including Central Enrollment, Babysitter Referral, Special Needs Accommodation Process (SNAP), Volunteer Child Care in a Unit Setting.

title: North Carolina National Guard - Child & Youth Progams
content: Access information specific to National Guard children. Learn about social and emotional needs of children and find events through Operation Kids on Guard.

title: Fort Bragg - Solider & Family Assistance Center
content: Find resources and programs to support soldiers and their families.

title: United Service Organization (USO) - North Carolina
content: Find support services, recreation activities and volunteer opportunities for Service Members and military families.

title: Autism Society of North Carolina
content: Works to improve services for people with autism spectrum disorders (ASD) and their families through education and advocacy. Provides tools, information, resources and support.

title: The ARC of North Carolina
content: Provides advocacy, education and awareness, as well as services and support for people with intellectual and developmental disabilities and their families. Find local chapters of the ARC in North Carolina.

title: Family Caregiver Support Program - North Dakota
content: Offers information to families and caregivers in the State of North Dakota including where to turn for support and assistance as well as services for caregivers.

title: Family Caregiver Alliance - North Dakota Caregiver Programs
content: Find information on programs funded through the National Family Caregiver Support Program, Aged/Disabled Medicaid waivers and North Dakota state-funded programs that either have a caregiver-specific focus, or include a family caregiving component in their service package.

title: Family Caregiver Alliance - North Dakota State Profile
content: Provides background characteristics for North Dakota related to caregiving and aging as well as information on publicly-funded caregiver support programs.

title: Army Family Readiness Groups (FRGs) in North Dakota
content: Provides a list of Army FRGs located in North Dakota, which provide a connection to unit information for spouses and other family members.

title: Military HOMEFRONT - North Dakota State Resources
content: Links to advocacy, employment, housing, health care, legal, financial and other resources available to Service Members, Veterans and families in the State of North Dakota.

title: North Dakota State Summary of VA Programs & Services
content: Describes the full range of VA programs, benefits and services available to Veterans and their families in North Dakota.  Resources include information on health care facilities, counseling centers and vocational rehabilitation. Download the VA's North Dakota fact sheet.

title: North Dakota Department of Human Services
content: Helps older North Dakota residents to be as independent as possible for as long as possible through advocacy, development and delivery of policies, programs and services which support and empower the elderly and their families.

title: Operation Military Kids - North Dakota
content: Supports youth of North Dakota military families from all branches of service through collaboration with community partners during all stages of deployment and peacetime.

title: Grand Forks Airman & Family Readiness Center
content: Provides Airmen, supervisors, Commanders and family members with the information, services and resources to successfully adapt to the unique and sometimes difficult stressors of military life, while preparing for eventual transition to the civilian world. Find information on upcoming base events along with helpful services and resources.

title: Grand Forks Air Force Base Relocation Assistance
content: Find information for newcomers to Grand Forks Air Force Base along with scheduled seminars. Learn about the base's Loan Locker that helps get you started with some furniture and other items to use until you and your family are established. Learn about child care offered by the Air Force Aid Society creating a safe space for children during their parents Permanent Change of Station (PCS).

title: Grand Forks Air Force Base School Liaison
content: Find information on the school liaison program, which helps military children transition to and from the local school system. Also learn about newcomer information and important base contact phone numbers.

title: Minot Air Force Base - Airman & Family Readiness Center
content: Find information on services, resources and programs including: relocation assistance, household loan items, military spouse orientation, career development, Air Force Aid Society, financial counseling, relationship enhancement consultations, volunteer opportunities, transition to civilian life and much more.

title: National Guard North Dakota Family Assistance Center (FAC)
content: Provides information and resources to families of all Service Members. Services include: ID cards, DEERS enrollment, Tricare medical and dental assistance, emergency and financial assistance, legal, mental and emotional health referrals, coordinates with military and civilian assistance agencies.

title: North Dakota National Guard Emergency Relief Fund
content: Provides financial support in emergency situations, such as natural disasters, accident, illness, fire or theft. All North Dakota National Guard soldiers, airmen, and their dependents are eligible for assistance.

title: North Dakota National Guard Child & Youth Program
content: Supports the social, emotional and academic needs of military children and youth. It encourages the development of positive self-esteem, self-confidence, team skills and leadership abilities through training tools, events and workshops.

title: North Dakota National Guard Family Resources
content: Find information for military families before, after and during deployment including local resources and DVDs and support programs.

title: North Dakota National Guard Military Funeral Honors
content: Provides professional Military Funeral Honors to eligible Veterans when requested by an authorized family member. The Rendering of Military Funeral Honors is a way to show the nation's deep gratitude to those who have faithfully defended our country in time of war and peace.

title: North Dakota Women, Infants & Children (WIC) Program (WIC)
content: Learn about WIC, a program for pregnant and breastfeeding women, infants and children younger than 5 and is available in all counties in North Dakota. WIC offers healthy food for proper growth and development and helps families choose healthier ways of eating.

title: North Dakota Supplemental Nutrition Assistance Program (SNAP)
content: Find information on the state's food assistance benefits. Download an  application for assistance and/or contact your local county social service office.

title: Early Childhood Services in North Dakota
content: Provides information on child care services. Find information on financial assistance, licensing requirements and local social service agencies in North Dakota.

title: Military Ovation
content: Supports Veterans and their families through employment, education, training and support programs.

title: Autism Society of North Dakota
content: Works to improve services for people with autism spectrum disorders (ASD) and their families through education, advocacy and public awareness. Advocates for services for individuals and provides information on treatment and research.

title: The ARC Chapters in North Dakota
content: Provides advocacy, education, awareness and support for people with intellectual and developmental disabilities and their families.

title: Ohio Department of Aging
content: Helps older Ohio residents to be as independent as possible for as long as possible through advocacy, development and delivery of policies, programs and services which support and empower the elderly and their families.

title: National Family Caregiver Support Program
content: Funds information and referral, training, counseling, support groups, respite and other services for caregivers. Contact your Area Agency on Aging to learn more about caregiver support programs where you live.

title: Family Caregiver Alliance - Ohio Caregiver Programs
content: Find information on programs funded through the National Family Caregiver Support Program, Aged/Disabled Medicaid waivers and Ohio state-funded programs that either have a caregiver-specific focus, or include a family caregiving component in their service package.

title: Family Caregiver Alliance - Ohio State Profile
content: Provides background characteristics for Ohio related to caregiving and aging as well as information on publicly-funded caregiver support programs.

title: Ohio Department of Job & Family Services - Military Injury Relief Fund (MIRF)
content: Grants money to soldiers injured while serving on active duty in Operation Enduring Freedom (OEF) or Operation Iraqi Freedom (OIF).

title: Network of Care for Seniors & People with Disabilities
content: Provides an extensive directory to put the elderly and caregivers in touch with the right services at the right time.

title: Operation Homefront Ohio
content: Provides emergency financial and other assistance to Service Members, Veterans and their families to help support their urgent household needs.

title: Operation Military Kids - Ohio
content: Provides support to Army installations and geographically dispersed military youth who are affected by the global war on terrorism.

title: Army Family Readiness Groups (FRGs) in Ohio
content: Provides a list of Army FRGs located in Ohio, which provide a connection to unit information for spouses and other family members.

title: Veterans with Disabilities: Family Support Resources
content: Find resources that help Veterans and families struggling with family stability, such as dealing with the emotional impact of deployment and care for a child or other family member with a disability.

title: Fisher House Comfort Homes - Ohio
content: Provides free temporary housing for families of patients receiving medical care at major military and VA medical centers in Ohio.

title: Bob Hope United Service Organization (USO) Lounge Cleveland Hopkins Airport

content: Provides vital information to help link consumers to support groups and personal advocacy resources in Texas. The site also provides information on successful, creative ways for communities to respond to their behavioral-health needs.

title: Family Services of Greater Houston
content: Offers a dedicated program to help military personnel and Veterans reintegrate into the community and reestablish their relationships with their families. Staff also help clients find housing, transportation and other services to ensure a smooth transition back to their families and the community.

title: Fisher House Comfort Homes - Texas
content: Provides free temporary housing for families of patients receiving medical care at major military and VA medical centers in Texas.

title: Operation Lone Star - Texans Supporting Our Troops

content: Helps individuals and families enhance their quality of life, and supports commanders as the focal point for issues important to families. Single or married Active Duty, Guard, Reservist, Retired Military members and each of their families, as well as DoD civilians are eligible for services that include relocation, community referrals, counseling and much more.

The FRSA can help you connect to your Soldier's Family Readiness Group (FRG). If you do not know to which unit your Soldier belongs, feel free to contact the Family Readiness Program Managers or Coordinators.

title: Naval Medical Center Portsmouth - Free Child Waiting Center

Examples include but are not limited to:  nutrition, GYN/OB, oncology, glucose testing, chapel services and Fleet and Family Services. title: Norfolk Naval Shipyard - Child Development Center
content: Offers care for children ages 6 weeks to five years. The hours of operation are 6:00 a.m. to 6:00 p.m. Monday through Friday. Well-trained child development professionals offer a program of varied activities in an environment designed to enhance cognitive, emotional, social and physical growth.

title: Norfolk Naval Shipyard - Youth Activities
content: Find programs for ages 5 (completed kindergarten) to 18 (still in high school) years. Programs include: holiday and seasonal camps and activities, movies, dances, carnivals, sports leagues and other community-based programs and activities.  The School Age Care (SAC) program is before and after school and half-day kindergarten care program.  The SAC program provides transportation to and from local public schools. Hours of the center are 6 a.m. to 6 p.m.
