content: Find information at the Navy Housing Office Welcome Center on housing options and community resources. The office is located in Bldg #2028, Room 115, across the street from Branch Medical. Find directions and forms through this link.

title: Naval Air Station Whidbey Island - Family Housing
content: Find information at the Navy Housing Office, located in the Nor'Wester, for incoming military and their families on information about housing options and community resources. The Whidbey Island's Nor'Wester is located on Ault Field. This link will take you to directions and housing applications.

title: Navy Region Northwest Relocation Assistance
content: Find helpful information and links for Navy and Marine Corps families on relocation to the Northwest region.

title: Our Forgotten Warriors - Family Support Service
content: Offers military families funding for goods, services or home modifications, as well as additional support programs.

title: Joint Base Lewis-McChord - Military & Family Life Consultants (MFLC)
content: Provides confidential short-term, situational counseling services to Service Members and their families.

title: Joint Base Lewis-McChord - Mobilization & Deployment Program (MOB/DEP)
content: Provides support to soldiers and their families through individual consultations, workshops, briefings and other services to enhance mission preparedness throughout the deployment cycle.

title: Joint Base Lewis-McChord - Relocation Readiness Program (RRP)
content: Provides services and programs to assist soldiers and their families with transfers and relocations, including citizenship and immigration assistance, workshops, counseling, pre-move planning, and help moving and settling into a new community.

title: Joint Base Lewis-McChord - Survivor Outreach Services (SOS)
content: Provides information on benefits, counseling and support groups for surviving family members. Includes information on resources especially for children.

title: Joint Base Lewis-McChord - Army Community Service (ACS) Outreach Program
content: Informs, educates, supports and assists soldiers and their families who are geographically or socially isolated from a military installation.

title: Joint Base Lewis-McChord - Soldier & Family Assistance Center (SFAC)
content: Helps Service Members and their families as they prepare for a transition back to their military career or into the civilian workforce.

title: Joint Base Lewis-McChord - Family Life Center
content: Offers family, marriage and individual counseling to Active Duty and retired Service Members, their family members and DoD civilians.

title: Joint Base Lewis-McChord - Child Development Services
content: Provides child care for children six weeks through 12 years of age with activities to help with school readiness and social, emotional, mental and physical development.

title: Joint Base Lewis-McChord - Child, Youth & School Services (CYSS) School-Age Program
content: Provides care and recreational programs for school age children before and after school, as well as on weekdays when school is closed and during winter, spring and summer breaks.

title: Joint Base Lewis-McChord - School Liaison Office (SLO)
content: Helps families with school-related issues by providing information, referrals, personal support and help coordinating with local school districts.

title: Joint Base Lewis-McChord - Child, Youth & School Services (CYSS) Family Child Care
content: Offers childcare in a home setting for children from four weeks to 12 years of age.

title: Child Care Subsidy Programs - Washington
content: Provides information about the child care subsidy programs. Find out how to apply and search for a local child care network agency in Washington.

title: RallyPoint/6
content: Supports Veterans and their families through mentoring in education and employment. Part of the Community Blueprint Network.

title: Joint Base Lewis-McChord - Army Family Action Plan (AFAP)
content: Provides a forum for all members of the Army and their families to voice concerns to Army leadership, make recommendations for change and improve the quality of life of military community members.

title: Joint Base Lewis-McChord - Exceptional Family Member Program (EFMP)
content: A mandatory enrollment program that works with other military and civilian agencies to provide medical, educational and community support services to families with special needs.

title: Joint Base Lewis-McChord - Family Advocacy Program (FAP)
content: Provides programs, services, education, training and activities that support soldiers and families, enhance relationship skills and improve their quality of life. FAP also provides victim advocates 24 hours a day, 7 days a week for those who are victims of domestic violence or who are victims of sexual assault. Call 253-966-SAFE or 253-966-7233.

title: Joint Base Lewis-McChord - Financial Readiness Program (FRP)
content: Counsels and educates Service Members and their families on financial self-sufficiency. Classes focus on the importance of managing personal financial affairs, living within one’s means, having emergency savings set aside, setting and meeting personal financial goals and planning for retirement.

title: Joint Base Lewis-McChord - Army Emergency Relief (AER)
content: Provides emergency financial assistance to Active Duty and retired soldiers and their families when there is a valid need.

title: Autism Society Washington Chapter
content: Serves individuals on the autism spectrum, their families and communities by providing information, support and advocacy. Works to improve the quality of and access to services and educational opportunities.

title: The ARC of Washington State
content: Advocates for the rights and full participation of all people with intellectual and developmental disabilities. Works to support individuals and families, improve support and service systems, and increase public awareness. Find local chapters of the ARC in Washington.

title: Joint Base Lewis-McChord - Retirement Services Office (RSO)
content: Provides counseling and group briefings for retiring soldiers and their family members.

title: McChord Escape Zone Parent & Child Activity Center
content: Offers parents and their children ages 5 and younger a chance to play, learn and socialize with other parents and children.

title: FOCUS Project: Family Resiliency Training for Military Families
content: Provides resiliency training for families and children facing the challenges of combat operational stress while loved ones are deployed. Learn about available assistance,, and find programs in California, Hawaii, Mississippi, North Carolina, Virginia, Washington and Okinawa.

title: Family Caregiver Alliance - West Virginia Programs
content: Find information on programs funded through the National Family Caregiver Support Program, Aged/Disabled Medicaid waivers and state-funded programs that either have a caregiver-specific focus or include a family caregiving component in their service package.

title: Army Family Readiness Groups (FRGs) in West Virginia
content: Provides a list of Army FRGs located in West Virginia, which provide a connection to unit information for spouses and other family members.

title: Military HOMEFRONT - West Virginia State Resources
content: Links to advocacy, employment, housing, health care, legal, financial and other resources available to Service Members, Veterans and families in the State of West Virginia.

title: Operation Military Kids - West Virginia
content: Provides support to Army installations and geographically dispersed military youth who are affected by the global war on terrorism.

title: Family Caregiver Alliance - West Virginia State Profile
content: Provides background characteristics for West Virginia related to caregiving and aging as well as information on publicly-funded caregiver support programs.

title: Chapel Hill Training - Outreach Project, Inc.
content: Provides programs that enhance the lives of children, youth and families. Aims to help families in poverty, families caring for the elderly, children with disabilities or chronic illness and those at risk of abuse and neglect.

title: West Virginia Bureau of Senior Services
content: Helps older residents of West Virginia to be as independent as possible for as long as possible through advocacy, development and delivery of policies, programs and services that support and empower the elderly and their families.

title: VA Vet Centers in West Virginia
content: Provides readjustment counseling and outreach services to all Veterans who served in any combat zone and to their families for military-related issues.

title: Navy Information Operations Command Sugar Grove Lincoln Family Housing
content: Contact the Housing Director at (304) 249-6306 upon receipt of orders to obtain current information concerning on or off base housing and sales in the area.

title: 2-1-1 West Virginia
content: Call 2-1-1 for information about important health and human services in West Virginia. 2-1-1 connects you to programs and services such as health care, housing, help paying utilities, transportation, mental health counseling and more.

title: Child Care in West Virginia
content: Provides resources and financial assistance to eligible families through the Child Care Resource and Referral agencies. Find local child care services in West Virginia.

title: The ARC of West Virginia
content: Advocates for awareness and support for people with intellectual and developmental disabilities and their families. Provides access to local chapters of the ARC in West Virginia.

title: Wisconsin Department of Veterans Affairs
content: Access resources on traumatic brain injury (TBI) and post-traumatic stress disorder (PTSD), loans, grants, burials, Veterans homes, claims assistance, educational and employment assistance and much more.

title: Northwoods Family Resource Connection - Northwoods 2-1-1
content: Connects people with important community resources and services.

title: Air Force Aid Society
content: Provides emergency assistance, education programs and community programs to Airmen and their families.

title: Army Emergency Relief (AER) Sections in Wisconsin
content: Provides locations and contact information for AER Sections in Wisconsin. AER provides emergency financial assistance to soldiers, Veterans and their dependents when there is a valid need.

title: Army Family Readiness Groups (FRGs) in Wisconsin
content: Provides a list of Army FRGs located in Wisconsin, which provide a connection to unit information for spouses and other family members.

title: Military HOMEFRONT - Wisconsin State Resources
content: Links to advocacy, employment, housing, health care, legal, financial and other resources available to Service Members, Veterans and families in the State of Wisconsin.

title: Milwaukee County Department on Aging
content: Offers information, consultation, assistance and referrals regarding short- and long-term services for older adults residing in Milwaukee County.

title: United Way of Dane County 2-1-1
content: Connecting you to community information and referrals to services available in Dane County, WI.

title: Wisconsin Family Caregiver Support Program
content: Offers information to families and caregivers in the State of Wisconsin including where to turn for support and assistance as well as services for caregivers.

title: United Way of Marathon County 2-1-1
content:
Connecting you to community information and referrals to services
available in Marathon and Portage County, WI. Helps answer questions and connect you to services 24 hours a day, 7 days a week, by phone, through publications, via the online searchable database, or by e-mail.

title: Vet Centers in Wisconsin
content: Provides readjustment counseling and outreach services to all Veterans who served in any combat zone and to their families for military-related issues.

title: Operation Military Kids - Wisconsin
content: Provides support to Army installations and geographically dispersed military youth who are affected by the global war on terrorism.

title: Family Caregiving Alliance - Wisconsin Caregiver Programs
content: Find information on programs funded through the National Family Caregiver Support Program, Aged/Disabled Medicaid waivers, and state-funded programs that either have a caregiver-specific focus, or include a family caregiving component in their service package.

title: Family Caregiver Alliance - Wisconsin State Profile
content: Provides background characteristics for Wisconsin related to caregiving and aging as well as information on publicly-funded caregiver support programs.

title: Dryhootch
content: Offers groups on post-traumatic stress, addiction, Veteran benefits, homeless issues, eduction, Veterans' legal assistance and family reintegration issues.

title: 2-1-1 Racine and Safe Haven, Inc.
content: Provides human services information and referral, supportive listening and crisis intervention services to the residents of Racine County.

title: Inner Wisconsin United Way 2-1-1
content: Connecting you to community information and referrals to services in Inner Wisconsin and the Marshfield Area.

title: Wisconsin Bureau of Aging & Disability Resources
content: Helps older Wisconsiners to be as independent as possible for as long as possible through advocacy, development and delivery of policies, programs and services which support and empower the elderly and their families.

title: Operation Homefront Wisconsin
content: Provides emergency financial and other assistance to Service Members, Veterans and their families to help support their urgent household needs.

title: Respite Care Association of Wisconsin
content: Provides programs that enhance the lives of children, youth and families. Aims to help families in poverty, families caring for the elderly, children with disabilities or chronic illness and those at risk of abuse and neglect.

title: Project New Hope
content: Provides free retreats in a camp-like setting for Veterans and their families.

title: Early Care & Education - Wisconsin
content: Provides details on child care providers and programs. Find information on financial assistance, licensing regulations and search for local facilities in Wisconsin.

title: Autism Society of Wisconsin
content: Provides support and information to the autism community in Wisconsin. Sponsors an annual conference, a free quarterly newsletter and maintains a Wisconsin directory of information and assistance.

title: The ARC - Wisconsin Disability Association
content: Provides advocacy, training and awareness, as well as assistance and quality of life opportunities for people with intellectual and developmental disabilities and their families. Find a local chapter of the ARC in Wisconsin.

title: 2-1-1 Wisconsin
content: Call 2-1-1 for information about important health and human services in Wisconsin. 2-1-1 connects you to programs and services such as health care, housing, help paying utilities, transportation, mental health counseling and more.

title: Operation Military Kids - Wyoming
content: Creates programs that support military youth before, during and after deployments with a special emphasis on children of National Guard and Reserve personnel.

title: Family Caregiver Alliance - Wyoming Caregiver Programs
content: Find information on programs funded through the National Family Caregiver Support Program, Aged/Disabled Medicaid waivers, and state-funded programs that either have a caregiver-specific focus, or include a family caregiving component in their service package.

title: National Family Caregiver Support Program
content: Offers information to families and caregivers in the State of Wyoming including where to turn for support and assistance as well as services for caregivers.

title: Army Family Readiness Groups (FRGs) in Wyoming
content: Provides a list of Army FRGs located in Wyoming, which provide a connection to unit information for spouses and other family members.

title: Military HOMEFRONT - Wyoming State Resources
content: Links to advocacy, employment, housing, health care, legal, financial and other resources available to Service Members, Veterans and families in the State of Wyoming.

title: Vet Centers in Wyoming
content: Provides readjustment counseling and outreach services to all Veterans who served in any combat zone and to their families for military-related issues.

title: Wyoming Aging Division
content: Helps older Wyoming residents to be as independent as possible for as long as possible through advocacy, development and delivery of policies, programs and services which support and empower the elderly and their families.

title: Wyoming National Guard Family Program
content: Provides information on Family Resource Centers and Transition Assistance along with resources and links for families.

title: Wyoming Department of Health Veteran & Family Resources
content: Find contact information for VA Outpatient Clinics, Chaplains, Wyoming National Guard Family Assistance Centers and Community Mental Health and Substance Abuse Clinics.

title: Supplemental Nutrition Assistance Program (SNAP)
content: Provides support to needy households and to those moving from welfare to work. SNAP benefits are distributed electronically through the Wyoming Card. SNAP supports better nutrition for low-income households.

title: F.E. Warren Air Force Base - Airman & Family Readiness Center (AFRC)
content: Serves as a one-stop information and referral center for single, married, active duty, National Guard, Reserves, retired members, spouses and families. From Air Force Aid Society to Transition Assistance, the AFRC offers services and programs through classes and group activities to units and individuals.

title: Early Childhood Programs - Wyoming
content: Provides information on child care programs in Wyoming. Access an application for financial assistance and find a list of local facilities.

title: The ARC Chapters in Wyoming
content: Provides advocacy, education and awareness, as well as programs and support for people with intellectual and developmental disabilities and their families.

title: 2-1-1 Wyoming
content: Call 2-1-1 for information about important health and human services in Wyoming. 2-1-1 connects you to programs and services that can help you access health care, housing, help paying utilities, transportation, mental health counseling and more.

title: Guam Family Caregiver Support Program
content: Provides information, assistance and resources to family caregivers in Guam.

title: Airman's Attic
content: Offers junior enlisted Airmen and their families a place to go to receive free donated goods. All items are free for Airmen who are E-5 and below and available items range from baby supplies to military uniforms.

title: Department of Defense Education Activity (DODEA) - Pacific
content: Find information on education options for children of families stationed at U.S. military instillations in the Pacific and Guam.

title: 36 Force Support Squadron
content: Find information about MWR activities and family support resources.

title: Puerto Rico Office on Aging
content: Helps older residents of Puerto Rico to be as independent as possible for as long as possible through advocacy, development and delivery of policies, programs and services that support and empower the elderly and their families.

title: Family Caregiver Support - Puerto Rico Contacts
content: Provides contact information for the Governor's Office on Elderly Affairs, which can provide resources and information for family caregivers.

title: Operation Military Kids - Virgin Islands
content: Provides support to Army installations and geographically dispersed military youth who are affected by the global war on terrorism.

title: VA Vet Centers in Virgin Islands
content: Provides readjustment counseling and outreach services to all Veterans who served in any combat zone and to their families for military-related issues.

title: MyArmyBenefits - My Benefits
content: Produces personalized financial reports to calculate survivor and retirement benefits for soldiers on Active Duty.

title: Frequently Asked Questions about Traumatic Servicemembers' & Veterans' Group Life Insurance (TSGLI)
content: Find general information about TSGLI, including coverage, premiums, eligibility and claims, payment of benefits and contact information.

title: Traumatic Servicemembers' & Veterans' Group Life Insurance (TSGLI) Procedures Guide
content: Provides procedures required for enrollment in TSGLI, including general provisions, coverage, procedures for certification, payment of benefits, denial and appeals process and more.

title: MyArmyBenefits - Benefit Facts
content: Provides information on pay, education, family services, health care, life insurance, soldier services, transitioning and retirement, Social Security, casualty/survivor and VA benefits. Benefits can be searched by category, component, life event, state/territory or index.

title: VA Benefits Page
content: Search the VA's benefits page for information on benefits for different disabilities and injuries.

title: Veterans Disability Compensation
content: Find out about service-related disability pay, how to apply for benefits, and whether you qualify for paid travel expenses related to a disability.

title: Wounded Warrior Entitlements Handbook
content: Learn about pay and entitlements for Service Members injured in a combat zone and receiving medical treatment at military facilities outside of the zone.

title: Wounded Warrior Pay
content: Financial support to Service Members medically evacuated while serving in a combat zone, including assistance in starting, changing or stopping entitlements due to circumstances and understanding tax-free entitlements.

title: Defense Finance & Accounting Service (DFAS)
content: Access to military, civilian, retired, travel and contract/vendor pay. Includes information on wounded warrior pay, financial benefits and the Thrift Savings Plan (TSP).

title: MyArmyBenefits - Wounded Warrior Disability Income Calculator
content: Estimates disability-related income as a result of combat and combat-related injuries. Requires valid wounded warrior-provided passcode and active Army Knowledge Online (AKO) account.

title: MyArmyBenefits - Wounded Warrior Sustaining Income Calculator
content: Calculates estimated monthly income stream based on injury date, rank, time in service, duty station, special pays and family status.

title: Retirement Pay Calculator
content: Use this online tool from DoD to find out what your estimated retirement pay will be.

title: Veterans Disability Compensation Tables
content: Use easy-to-read tables to see how much your disability pay will be.

title: Benefits & Entitlements Overview
content: Provides information on military pay and benefits including housing and subsistence allowances and National Guard and Reserve benefits and pay.

title: DoD Military Pay & Benefits
content: Provides information on military pay and benefits, including Active Duty pay, retirement pay, survivor benefits and the Thrift Savings Plan.

title: Benefits.gov - Veterans Pension for Non-Service-Connected Disability
content: Find benefits information for non-service-connected disabilities, including general program requirements and guide to the application process to receive benefits.

title: Air Force Personnel Center
content: Manages the Air Force Retiree Activities Program and the Survivor Benefit Plan, and the Air Force Assistance Fund (AFAF).

title: Tax Information for Members of the Military
content: Find Internal Revenue Service (IRS) tax information regarding combat pay, retirement plans, extension of deadlines and free tax return preparation.

title: Tax Relief for Retirement Plan Payments
content: Read about the Pension Protection Act, which allows Reservists to receive payments from their individual retirement accounts, 401(k) plans and 403(b) tax-sheltered annuities, without having to pay an early-distribution tax.

title: Military One Source-Tax Filing Service
content: Prepare your state and federal taxes with this easy-to-use program. Provided by the Department of Defense and it is and free to active duty, National Guard, and Reserve service members and their families.

title: Army Combat-Related Special Compensation (CRSC)
content: Provides updates about Combat Related Special Compensation eligibility. CRSC provides tax-free monthly payments to eligible retired Veterans with combat-related injuries.

title: VA Life Insurance Policies
content: Provides information on the life insurance policies offered by the VA to Service Members, Veterans, disabled Veterans and their family members.

title: Tax Information for Members of the U.S. Armed Forces
content: Find information on tax laws affecting the military and questions and answers on combat zone tax provisions.

title: Free Tax Help for Military Personnel & Their Families
content: The Internal Revenue Service (IRS) and U.S. Armed Forces participate in the Volunteer Income Tax Assistance program, which provides free tax advice, tax preparation, return filing and other tax assistance to military members and their families.

title: Consumer Financial Protection Bureau (CFPB) - Helping You Save
content: Highlights resources for Service Members to gain financial independence.

title: United Service Organizations (USO)
content: Provides morale, welfare and recreation-type services to Service Members and their families.

title: Family & Friends for Freedom Fund
content: Provides financial assistance to injured Marines and their families, those with post-traumatic stress disorder (PTSD), and to all military branches as the need arises. Download the Application for Financial Assistance.

title: Navy-Marine Corps Relief Society Financial Assistance
content: Provides interest-free loans or grants to help with emergency needs such as transportation, vehicle repairs, funeral expenses, medical bills, food, rent, utilities and child care expenses.

title: Air Force Aid Society (AFAS)
content: Helps relieve financial distress of Air Force members and families and assists them in financing their education.

title: Air Force Aid Society (AFAS) Falcon Loan
content: Provides information and instructions on applying for the Falcon Loan of $500 or less for emergency needs such as basic living expenses, car repairs, emergency travel or other approved needs.

title: Air Force Assistance Fund (AFAF)
content: Raises funds for charitable affiliates that provide support to the Air Force family, including emergency aid, education needs and financial assistance. Provides links to the Air Force Village Foundation, the Air Force Aid Society, the General and Mrs. Curtis E. Lemay Foundation, and the Air Force Enlisted Village.

title: Army Emergency Relief (AER)
content: Helps soldiers and dependents through emergency financial assistance. There are 91 AER Sections of U.S. Army installations worldwide. Find the nearest location here.

title: American Legion Auxiliary
content: Offers a wide variety of services and support, including scholarships, mentorship opportunities, programs and resources to strengthen Veterans, Service Members and their families. It is the world's largest patriotic women's service organization.

title: American Legion Temporary Financial Assistance (TFA)
content: Program assists minor children of eligible Veterans through cash grants to cover needs such as housing, food and medical bills.

title: American Red Cross Emergency Financial Services for Active Duty Military Personnel
content: Get emergency help for Service Members and families, including assistance for food, temporary lodging, travel, urgent medical needs, and utility assistance.

title: Coast Guard Mutual Assistance
content: Provides financial assistance for emergency, short-term situations. Learn about the various categories of assistance that are offered.

title: Injured Marine Semper Fi Fund
content: Provides financial assistance to injured Marines or other Service Members assigned to Marine forces to help with housing payments, adaptive vans or vehicles, education programs, and more.

title: Air Warrior Courage Foundation
content: Provides financial assistance to families of U.S. Armed Forces for medical expenses, therapeutic programs for children and support to surviving family-members of military personnel lost since September 11, 2001 or in the War on Terror.

title: Armed Forces Foundation
content: Provides financial support to Service Members for everyday living expenses, home improvements, transition and career counseling, funeral arrangements, travel expenses, and family counseling services. Download the Family Assistance Application.

title: Children of Fallen Soldiers Relief Fund
content: Offers college grants and financial assistance with housing, repairs, utilities, medical expenses and groceries for children and spouses of Service Members with disabilities and those who lost their lives in the Iraq and Afghanistan conflicts.

title: Eagles Watch Foundation
content: Provides encouragement and charitable support to those who defend freedom in the United States Armed Services, civilians, and contractors.

title: Fallen Patriot Fund
content: Helps families of U.S. military personnel who were killed or seriously injured during Operation Iraqi Freedom.

title: Fisher House Foundation Hero Miles Program
content: Provides free plane tickets to family members of wounded Service Members to visit their loved ones recovering at military hospitals across the country.

title: National Association of American Veterans - Services
content: Provides emergency financial assistance, counseling, scholarships, housing assistance and medical transportation.

title: Operation Family Fund
content: Provides financial grants for those injured and families of those who have been injured or killed as a part of the Global War on Terrorism, whether domestic or abroad, military or civilian. Assistance is available for food, mortgage or rent payments, utilities, emergency transportation, vehicle repair, funeral expenses, legal expenses, medical/dental expenses and more.

title: Operation First Response
content: Offers financial assistance to wounded Service Members for rent or mortgage payments, utilities, vehicle payments and repairs, food, clothing, transportation, and personal items.

title: Operation Forever Free
content: Provides assistance for Service Members and their families including funds for transportation, as well as modifying, remodeling and building homes.

title: Operation Homefront
content: Provides emergency assistance and information to Service Members, Veterans and their families to help support their urgent household needs.

title: Operation Mom
content: Offers support to the military, their families and those who support them by providing care packages to deployed troops, letters of encouragement, emergency funds for injured military and scholarships for dependents.

title: Pentagon Federal Credit Union Foundation
content: Provides financial services for wounded warriors including funds for day care expenses at Walter Reed Army Medical Center, hospice suite for Walter Reed patients with terminal cancer, payments for emergency financial needs and laptop computers for wounded warriors at the Fisher Houses at major military medical centers.

title: Rebuild Hope
content: Provides emergency and short-term financial assistance to the families of severely wounded OIF/OEF Veterans as they strive to build healthy and stable civilian lives. Assistance includes small grants and no-interest loans, help in developing realistic budgets, and complementary counseling and referral services. Donors can view individual Veteran profiles on the Rebuild Hope website and easily make donor-advised gifts knowing that 100% of designated donations are distributed to Veterans.

title: Reserve Aid
content: Provides emergency funds to reserve Service Members and their dependents who are in financial need as a result of deployment.

title: USA Cares
content: Offers financial assistance for wounded warriors and families, prevention of foreclosure or eviction and help with basic needs.

title: Veterans of Foreign Wars (VFW) - Unmet Needs Program
content: Offers eligible Veterans an emergency grant of up to $2,500 that is paid directly to creditors to address unmet financial needs.

title: Wounded Explosive Ordnance Disposal (EOD) Warrior Foundation
content: Provides financial relief to wounded EOD warriors and their families.

title: Wounded Heroes Foundation
content: Assists severely injured Service Members with physical, emotional and financial support, such as paying a missing mortgage payment, purchasing an accessible van, building or remodeling homes, securing a new mortgage at a lower interest rate and more.

title: Salute, Inc.
content: Provides financial support for Service Members, Veterans and their families through a variety of fundraising activities.

title: Armed Forces Reserve Family Assistance Fund (AFRFAF)
content: Provides assistance to dependents of deployed Army Reservists or National Guardsmen who face short-term financial needs and other emergencies.

title: Army Homefront Fund
content: Provides emergency financial and other support to the families of soldiers, with a focus on wounded warrior care and transition assistance. Includes cash grants, not loans, paid directly to mortgage lenders, auto mechanics, utility companies, doctors and other providers. Assistance is usually provided within 24-72 hours after receiving pertinent information from the warrior or family member. All requests for assistance are made through Operation Homefront online application for assistance.

title: Dealing with Creditors
content: Highlights actions military families can take under the Servicemembers' Civil Relief Act to reduce loan obligations, prevent court judgments and avoid eviction and foreclosure.

title: Education Debt Relief
content: Assists with relieving the educational debt of veterans who are serving and have served in the US Military.

title: Emergency Financial First Aid Kit
content: Identifies and organizes key financial records and provides a quick reference file for your most important financial documents to help you maintain financial stability in an emergency.

title: Military HUB Financial Management Center
content: Guides military families to make the best military financial choices, build wealth and save money while in the military. Also coaches through the process of leveraging your salary to support your family now and after retirement.

title: National Military Family Association - Money and You
content: Learn about how to manage money, prepare financially for moving, and get access to government resources that teach military families about saving for college, paying taxes, and investing.

title: Navy-Marine Corps Relief Society - Financial Assistance and Counseling
content: Provides information and resources to educate Service Members and their families on the basics of responsible money management.

title: American Red Cross
content: Search for local chapters that provide confidential services including counseling. Open to all military personnel - Active Duty, National Guard and Reserves - and their families.

title: Army Reserve Warrior & Family Assistance Center
content: Contains information on benefits, entitlements, financial counseling, peer support and other services for Army Reserve soldiers, Veterans and their families.

title: Military & Family Life Consultant (MFLC) Personal Financial Counseling Program
content: Offers personal financial counseling to Service Members and their families.

title: Military Money
content: Provides educational information and resources to help military families make better financial decisions. Created as part of the U.S. Department of Defense's Financial Readiness Campaign.

title: Military Saves
content: A partner in the DoD Financial Readiness Campaign and the national America Saves campaign, Military Saves is a growing network of organizations and individuals committed to helping and supporting military members and their loved ones build personal savings arsenals to provide for their immediate and long-term financial needs.

title: Plan for Financial Readiness Before Deployment
content: Find information on preparing your finances before deployment, including calculating your net worth, understanding your income and expenses, protecting your savings, protecting your property, establishing life insurance and more.

title: VeteransPlus
content: Provides free financial education and counseling services to Veterans, Service Members and their families that have one or more of the following risk factors: financial struggles, low credit score, lack of financial planning and/or a poor credit history.

title: National Military Family Association - Moving Advice
content: Find information to help with the moving process to a new duty station or new town. Learn about military regulations and benefits and even helpful allowances you may qualify for. The Get Ready page gets you started. The Making the Move page gets you through the move and the Settling In page helps you when you arrive.

title: Navy Safe Harbor Case Management
content: Assigns a care professional to help sailors and Coast Guardsmen identify short- and long-term goals and develop plans to achieve them. Also anticipates and addresses the day-to-day non-medical needs of enrolled Service Members and their families and works to resolve any problems that arise during recovery.

title: Family Counselor Fellowship for Military Spouses
content: Provides military spouses with the education necessary to enter the financial counseling career field.

title: Military Families Learning Network - Personal Finance
content:
Provides support to Service Members and their families through  engaged online communities providing best practices, information,  educational and curriculum materials, and  programming activities and  efforts.
The primary concentration areas for the Military Families Learning Network  are personal finance, child care, family development and network literacy.

title: Consumer Financial Protection Bureau (CFPB) - Helping You Save
content: Highlights resources for Service Members to gain financial independence.

title: Consumer Financial Protection Bureau (CFPB) - Servicemembers Civil Relief Act Information
content: Answers frequently asked questions about the Servicemembers Civil Relief Act.

title: Family & Medical Leave Act (FMLA) - Final Regulations
content: Describes military family leave entitlements in case a family member is called to active duty, in case of an emergency, or to care for a wounded Service Member or Veteran.

title: Family & Medical Leave Act (FMLA)
content: Provides information on the Family Medical Leave Act (FMLA), including links to FMLA news updates, fact sheets, and application forms to qualify for FMLA coverage.

title: Army Chaplain Corps
content:
Provides information about the role of Army chaplains in observing the distinctive doctrines of their faith, while honoring the right of others to observe their own faith. Rabbis, 
ministers, imams and priests all serve as Army chaplains.

title: Chaplain of the Coast Guard
content: Find frequently asked questions, links to religious resources and a list of locations.

title: Jewish Chaplains Council
content: Serves full-time military and VA chaplains, chaplain Reservists, military lay leaders and thousands of Jews at military installations and VA medical centers throughout the country and overseas.

title: Military Chaplains Association
content: Connects those who have served in the military with a variety of religious faith groups and chaplaincies.

title: Navy Chaplain Care
content: Offers daily devotions, self-help information and religious ministry and pastoral care to sailors, marines and their families. Visit the Global Distance Support Center to talk to or e-mail a chaplain.

title: afterdeployment.org - Spiritual Fitness
content: Learn how spiritual well-being can help you both cope with and understand your deployment experiences.

title: VA National Chaplain Center
content: Provides the names, locations and contact information for VA chaplains serving all denominations, as well as a master directory of chaplains.

title: CREDO
content: Join the Navy & Marine Corps' Chaplains Religious Enrichment Program which provides marriage retreats for couples.

title: Strong Bonds
content: Join the Army's Strong Bonds program to participate in marriage counseling, workshops, and retreats.

title: Friends for Survival
content: Provides a variety of peer support services that comfort those in grief, encourage healing and growth, foster the development of skills to cope with a loss and educate the entire community regarding the impact of suicide.

title: Gold Star Wives of America
content: Provides counseling, financial assistance and help with paying for college, as well as special resources for widows/widowers of Operations Enduring Freedom and Iraqi Freedom (OEF and OIF).

title: VA Bereavement Counseling
content: Offers bereavement counseling to parents, spouses and children of Armed Forces personnel who died in the service of their country.  Also eligible are family members of reservists and National Guardsmen who die while on duty. Contact Readjustment Counseling Service at 202-273-9116 or via e-mail at vet.center@va.gov.

title: American Red Cross Counseling Services for Military Personnel
content: Offers confidential counseling services to all military personnel - Active Duty, National Guard and Reserves - and their families. Find the chapter or office near you.

title: Coming Home Project
content: Offers programs that address the mental, emotional, spiritual and relationship challenges faced by Veterans and families before, during and after deployment.

title: Give an Hour - Free Mental Health Services
content: Provides free mental health services nationwide by mental health professionals who literally give an hour of their time each week to military personnel and their families.

title: Mental Health & Substance Abuse Services
content: Contact a free mental health counseling service that can help with problems relating to alcohol and drug addiction, depression, bereavement and other counseling and treatment needs.

title: Mental Health America (MHA) Affiliate Directory
content: Contact the local MHA affiliates in your state that can help you find support groups in your area.

title: Mental Health Resources for Returning Veterans & Their Families
content: Access information from the Substance Abuse & Mental Health Services Administration (SAMHSA) about prevention, treatment and recovery support for mental health and substance use disorders.

title: Military OneSource
content: Speak to live Military OneSource consultants that are available 24 hours a day. Information and assistance available to Active Duty Service Members, Reservists and family members.

title: National Mental Health Information Center - By Topic List
content: Links to a number of mental health resources covering topics from administration and policy to treatment and recovery.

title: Rape Abuse & Incest National Network (RAINN)
content: Operates the National Sexual Assault Hotline at 1-800-656-HOPE (4673), educates the public about sexual assault and leads national efforts to prevent sexual assault, improve services to victims and ensure that rapists are brought to justice.

title: The PAIRS Foundation
content: Offers free, confidential 90-minute online classes to help deploying and returning combat Veterans and family members prepare for and face the challenges brought on by post-traumatic stress disorder (PTSD).

title: Vet Centers
content: Provides readjustment counseling and outreach services to all Veterans, including individual and group counseling, marital and family counseling, bereavement counseling and more. Find the Vet Center in your state.

title: Family & Children's
content: Provides counseling for veterans and their families to help understand and support their servicemember. Find education counseling for veterans, as well.

title: Real Warriors - Suicide Prevention Resources for Military Families
content: Information about how to tell if a loved one may be having thoughts of suicide, and what you can do to help them. For immediate help call the Veterans Crisis Line at 1-800-273-TALK and press 1. You can also send a text message to 838255 to receive confidential support.

title: Rape Abuse & Incest National Network (RAINN)
content: Operates the National Sexual Assault Hotline at 1-800-656-HOPE (4673), educates the public about sexual assault and leads national efforts to prevent sexual assault, improve services to victims and ensure that rapists are brought to justice.

title: Women Veterans Health Care
content: Provides information on health care services available to women Veterans, including comprehensive primary care, specialty care covering reproductive services, and rehabilitation, mental health and treatment for military sexual trauma. Contact the nearest VA Medical Center and ask for the Women Veterans Program Manager.

title: Womenshealth.gov - Sexual Assault
content: Provides answers to frequently asked questions including where to go for help or for more information.

title: National Center on Domestic & Sexual Violence - Military Response
content: Provides resources and research on domestic and sexual violence, with specific information for military and Veterans.

title: Navy Sexual Assault Prevention & Response
content: Find information on what to do if you or someone you know is sexually assaulted or harressed in the Navy. Find contact information and resources.

title: DoD Sexual Assault Prevention & Response (SAPRO)
content: Access information for military victims of sexual assault, unit commanders, first responders and others who wish to prevent or respond to this crime. What to do if you have been assaulted.

title: Military Sexual Trauma Counseling
content: Access free sexual trauma counseling and treatment at VA medical facilities.

title: Military Sexual Trauma Program
content: Contact the Military Sexual Trauma Coordinator or Women Veterans Program Manager at your nearest VA facility or call toll free 1-800-827-1000.

title: National Guard - Sexual Assault Prevention & Response
content: Provides information on the National Guard Bureau commitment to eliminating incidents of sexual assault. Includes information on policies, procedures and hotline numbers.

title: Air Force Sexual Assault Prevention & Response Program
content: Find resources, procedures and options if you or someone you know has been sexually assaulted or harassed in the Air Force.

title: Marine Corps Sexual Assault Prevention & Response
content: Find resources and procedures if you or someone you know has been sexually assaulted or harassed in the Marine Corps.

title: Coast Guard Office of Work-Life Programs - Sexual Assault Prevention & Response Program
content: Find resources and procedures if you or someone you know has been sexually assaulted or harassed in the Coast Guard

title: Battered Women's Justice Project - Military Advocacy Resource Network
content: Provides technical assistance, resources, and support for all advocates, military and civilian, who serve military and Veteran families and work with victims of domestic violence/sexual assault/stalking and dating violence perpetrated by military personnel or Veterans.

title: PAVE - Promoting Awareness, Victim Empowerment
content: Find resources and support to report sexual violence along with educational materials on how to stop sexual violence and domestic abuse.

title: Safe Helpline - Sexual Assault Support for the DoD Community
content: Provides secure online help to those who have been sexually assaulted. Members of the DoD community can also call or text 877-995-5247 for 24/7 world wide support.

title: National Center on Domestic & Sexual Violence - Military Response
content: Provides resources and research on domestic and sexual violence, with specific information for military and Veterans.

title: Domestic Abuse and Where to Find Help
content: Provides answers to questions about domestic violence and DoD's Family Advocacy Program, a command support program for military families who are facing issues of domestic abuse.

title: My Personal Safety Plan
content: Get information from the National Coalition Against Domestic Violence on protecting yourself from domestic violence. Find help in your state.

title: National Domestic Violence Hotline
content: Provides crisis intervention, information and referral to victims of domestic violence, perpetrators, friends and families. Call 1-800-799-SAFE (7233) or TTY 1-800-787-3224 for assistance 24 hours a day, 365 days a year.

title: Navy Family Advocacy Program
content: Provides clinical assessment, treatment and services for military members and their families involved in incidents of domestic abuse. Services include assessment of risk, safety planning and determination of appropriate interventions and/or treatment.

title: afterdeployment.org - Overcoming Anger
content: Recognize anger cues and learn strategies to manage anger. Offers an assessment, an electronic-library, game-based simulations and narrator-guided self-help workshops.

title: Vet Centers
content: Offers readjustment counseling and outreach services to Veterans who served in any combat zone. Services are also available for family members on military-related issues.

title: American Domestic Violence Crisis Line
content: Learn about a crisis line operates from 10 pm to 6 am, Pacific Standard Time, Monday through Friday. Call 1-866-USWOMEN (866-879-6636) for help.

title: Are You in an Abusive Relationship?
content: Access a checklist of behaviors to help decide if domestic violence is occurring.

title: Coast Guard Family Advocacy Program
content: Provides assessments and rehabilitation referrals, parenting classes, couples communications and substance abuse programs, referrals for financial assistance for victims and other services required to address the abusive situation.

title: Compensation for Abused Family Members
content: Provides Marine families who have experienced domestic violence with 12 to 36 months of compensation (payments vary based on circumstances).

title: DoD Commanding Officers Web-Based Domestic Violence Training
content: Access an interactive, self-paced training based on DoD policy regarding domestic abuse.

title: Domestic Abuse in Military Families
content: Access a fact sheet about domestic violence in the military. Includes information on traumatic brain injury, which can be sustained as a result of domestic violent acts.

title: Give an Hour - Free Mental Health Services
content: Provides free mental health services nationwide by mental health professionals who literally give an hour of their time each week to military personnel and their families.

title: Marine Corps Family Advocacy Program
content: Provides information on spouse/intimate partner and child abuse, victim advocacy, counseling for individuals, couples and children, as well as support groups for men and women.

title: Mental Health America (MHA) Affiliate Directory
content: Contact the local MHA affiliates in your state that can help you find support groups in your area.

title: Air Force Sexual Assault Prevention & Response Program
content: Find resources, procedures and options if you or someone you know has been sexually assaulted or harassed in the Air Force.

title: Preventing Child Abuse and Neglect
content: Find resources on child abuse prevention, protecting children from risk of abuse, and strengthening families. Includes information on supporting families, protective factors, public awareness, community activities, positive parenting, prevention programs, and more.

title: Coast Guard Office of Work-Life Programs - Sexual Assault Prevention & Response Program
content: Find resources and procedures if you or someone you know has been sexually assaulted or harassed in the Coast Guard

title: Marine Corps Sexual Assault Prevention & Response
content: Find resources and procedures if you or someone you know has been sexually assaulted or harassed in the Marine Corps.

title: The Rose Fund (Regaining One's Self Esteem)
content: Enables women survivors of domestic violence (DV) and teen dating violence (TDV) to rebuild their lives by providing them with a wide range of medical, dental and facial reconstructive surgeries and annual achievement awards.

title: Military & Family Life Consultant (MFLC) Victim Advocacy Services
content: Works with existing military domestic violence services to support victims of domestic violence.

title: Battered Women's Justice Project - Military Advocacy Resource Network
content: Provides technical assistance, resources, and support for all advocates, military and civilian, who serve military and Veteran families and work with victims of domestic violence/sexual assault/stalking and dating violence perpetrated by military personnel or Veterans.

title: PAVE - Promoting Awareness, Victim Empowerment
content: Find resources and support to report sexual violence along with educational materials on how to stop sexual violence and domestic abuse.

title: Renesselaer County Temporary Assistance Program
content: Provides cash assistance to needy families that include a minor child living with a parent (including families where both parents are in the household) or a caretaker relative.

title: Yates County Temporary Assistance
content: Learn about county and state-level temporary assistance programs including: family assistance, food stamps, Safety Net Assistance, Home Energy Assistance Program (HEAP) and child care services.

title: Tioga County Social Services Department
content: Learn about county programs that provide temporary assistance including: food stamps, Medicaid, cash grants, Home Energy Assistance Program (HEAP) and managed care.

title: Ontario County Temporary Assistance
content: Learn about the county's family support programs and their eligibility requirements. The Family Assistance and the Safety Net Programs provide temporary cash support to those who are living below the poverty level. The Temporary Assistance unit also manages the federal Food Stamp Program and the Home Energy Assistance program (HEAP).

title: Wyoming County Temporary Assistance Program
content: Learn about the Temporary Assistance Program offered by the county and eligibility requirements. If you are unable to work, can't find a job, or have a job that doesn't pay enough to meet your basic needs, Temporary Assistance may be able to help you by meeting such needs as rent, heat and utilities.

title: Oneida County Temporary Assistance Program
content: Determines and monitors eligibility for Temporary Assistance (family assistance and safety net assistance) and such programs as food stamps, Medicaid, emergency aid and the Home Energy Assistance Program. Receive help applying for benefits including: child support, daycare and safe affordable housing. Emergency Assistance is available to help those households in a crisis situation even though they may be ineligible for ongoing assistance.

title: Nassau County Temporary Assistance
content: Offers various county and state programs that helps families in need temporarily due to an emergency circumstance or for economic reasons.

title: Greene County Temporary Assistance
content: Provides temporary assistance through cash grants for needs including: food and clothing, rent and mortgage, food and utilities, pregnancy and emergency repairs or evictions.

title: Seneca County Temporary Assistance
content: Provides the address, hours and basic information for programs including: food stamps, cash assistance, Medicaid, Home Energy Assistance Program (HEAP) and emergency aid to families.

title: Military Family Support Centers, Inc.
content: Provides support and information to families of deployed Service Members including video conferencing, broadband Internet access, support groups, home and car repair assistance, transportation, child care, food and clothing, and counseling.

title: Naval Support Activity Norfolk Rental Partnership Program
content: Learn about this housing option for single or married DoD military personnel and U.S. Coast Guard personnel with at least one year remaining on active duty in the Hampton Roads area.

title: Hampton Roads Navy Housing
content: Learn about housing site locations, eligibility, the application process, housing types and wait periods both for married and single Service Members.

content: Provides free temporary housing for families of patients receiving medical care at major military and VA medical centers in Washington.

title: Naval Base Kitsap (NBK) Bangor Family Housing
content: Find information for incoming military and their families about housing options and community resources. The Naval Base Kitsap Housing office is located on NBK Bangor. Access this site for directions and forms.

title: Naval Station Everett Family Housing
content: Find information at the Navy Housing Office Welcome Center on housing options and community resources. The office is located in Bldg #2028, Room 115, across the street from Branch Medical. Find directions and forms through this link.

title: Naval Air Station Whidbey Island - Family Housing
content: Find information at the Navy Housing Office, located in the Nor'Wester, for incoming military and their families on information about housing options and community resources. The Whidbey Island's Nor'Wester is located on Ault Field. This link will take you to directions and housing applications.

title: Navy Information Operations Command Sugar Grove Lincoln Family Housing
content: Contact the Housing Director at (304) 249-6306 upon receipt of orders to obtain current information concerning on or off base housing and sales in the area.

title: American Red Cross Emergency Financial Services for Active Duty Military Personnel
content: Get emergency help for Service Members and families, including assistance for food, temporary lodging, travel, urgent medical needs, and utility assistance.

title: Injured Marine Semper Fi Fund
content: Provides financial assistance to injured Marines or other Service Members assigned to Marine forces to help with housing payments, adaptive vans or vehicles, education programs, and more.

title: National Association of American Veterans - Services

title: Navy-Marine Corps Relief Society Financial Assistance

title: Operation First Response
content: Offers financial assistance to wounded Service Members for rent or mortgage payments, utilities, vehicle payments and repairs, food, clothing, transportation, and personal items.

title: Operation Forever Free
content: Provides assistance for Service Members and their families including funds for transportation, as well as modifying, remodeling and building homes.

title: Operation Homefront
content: Provides emergency assistance and information to Service Members, Veterans and their families to help support their urgent household needs.

title: USA Cares

title: Reserve Aid

title: Armed Forces Foundation
content: Provides financial support to Service Members for everyday living expenses, home improvements, transition and career counseling, funeral arrangements, travel expenses, and family counseling services. Download the Family Assistance Application.

title: Naval Military Housing
content: Provides information and resources that can assist you in making a housing decision at your next duty station.

title: Navy Safe Harbor Case Management

Also anticipates and addresses the day-to-day non-medical needs of enrolled Service Members and their families and works to resolve any problems that arise during recovery.

title: Hope for the Warriors

title: Operation Forever Free
content: Provides assistance for Service Members and their families including funds for transportation, as well as modifying, remodeling and building homes.

title: Navy Safe Harbor
content: Provides non-medical support to seriously wounded, ill, and injured Sailors and Coast Guardsmen, as well as their families. Assists service members throughout their recovery, rehabilitation, and reintegration. For more assistance call 1-877-746-8563 or email safeharbor@navy.mil.

title: Handbook for Injured Service Members & Their Families
content: Offers a handbook published by the Intrepid Fallen Heroes Fund that outlines benefits, rights and resources available to Service Members and their families to help with financial, medical, educational, employment, legal and other needs.

title: Navy Safe Harbor Case Management
content: Assigns a care professional to help sailors and Coast Guardsmen identify short- and long-term goals and develop plans to achieve them. Also anticipates and addresses the day-to-day non-medical needs of enrolled Service Members and their families and works to resolve any problems that arise during recovery.

title: Navy Safe Harbor
content: Provides non-medical support to seriously wounded, ill, and injured Sailors and Coast Guardsmen, as well as their families. Assists service members throughout their recovery, rehabilitation, and reintegration. For more assistance call 1-877-746-8563 or email safeharbor@navy.mil.

title: Air Force Wounded Warrior Program (AFW2)
content: Provides personalized services to combat wounded, ill and injured airmen and their families through regular communication and support for non-medical matters. For more information and assistance call 1-800-581-9437.

title: Marine Corps Wounded Warrior Regiment
content: Provides assistance to wounded, injured and ill marines; sailors attached to or in support of Marine Corps units; and their family members throughout the phases of recovery.

title: Army Wounded Warrior Program (AW2)
content: Provides individualized support to severely wounded, injured and ill Army personnel and their families. Services to assist with career, education, finances, health care, insurance, retirement, transition and more are available. For more information and assistance, call 1-800-237-1336 or email  AW2@conus.army.mil.

title: U.S. Army Warrior Care & Transition Program (WCTP)
content: Enables the Army to evaluate and treat soldiers through a comprehensive, soldier-centric process of medical care, rehabilitation, professional development and achievement of personal goals.

title: Air Force Wounded Warrior Program (AFW2)
content: Provides personalized services to combat wounded, ill and injured airmen and their families through regular communication and support for non-medical matters. For more information and assistance call 1-800-581-9437.

title: Joining Forces
content: White House program that asks Americans to get involved in supporting our military's needs in employment, education, wellness and public awareness. Learn how to get involved.

title: Family & Medical Leave Act (FMLA)
content: FMLA is a federal law that guarantees unpaid leave from work to individuals with serious health conditions and to certain family members who care for them. Under the FMLA, certain family members may be eligible for unpaid leave from their jobs to care for a wounded Service Member. Read the fact sheet about recent changes to the law pertaining to military family leave.

title: Veterans Support Foundation
content: Helps homeless Veterans with shelter and benefits assistance programs across the country.

title: Veterans of Foreign Wars National Home For Children
content: Helps military and Veteran families and children through times of crisis and deployment with housing and services on a sprawling campus.

title: Military HOMEFRONT Legal Assistance Program
content: Assists with personal legal matters and provides legal advice to ensure that Service Members, families and retirees are protected per their legal rights.

title: Women Veterans Health Care
content: Provides information on health care services available to women Veterans, including comprehensive primary care, specialty care covering reproductive services, and rehabilitation, mental health and treatment for military sexual trauma. Contact the nearest VA Medical Center and ask for the Women Veterans Program Manager.
